text: Had a reservation for 10 people on Easter. We we all there on time for our reservation  but like every time we go had to wait over 20 minutes for our table. This happened to us last time we were there. We were sat at this awkward booth that sat 6 of us on one side and 4 on the other. It took our waitress 30 min to create our cheese fondue spilling it onto the burner which made it burn and it was still milky on top. So she had to keep adding more cheese until it was finally right. Cheese still burning on the burner. Next course was fine. Then it took 30 more minutes after our main course for the chocolate course. By now our burner was completely covered in burned cheese and smelled bad. While we were waiting for our chocolate we scraped our burner to stop the smell. They never even noticed the burned crust and plopped the next pot right on top. What started out as something fun became a disaster. We talked to the management about the long wait times but he said that's the way it is. Our bill for 6 adults and 4 kids was over $350 which would be fine with great service and no burned cheese. Vowing never to go back.
Johnny was an excellent server. Had a great time. Food was fantastic. I would highly recommend  having dinner here! !!!!!!!

We were here 3 - yes I typed three - hours for a meal with two little kids.  Very long waits between the courses with no attention from server.  Of the three hours at least 60 full minutes was spent without any food in front of us.  But the best part, incorrect charges on the bill.  Wines prices upcharged on actual receipt to 1.5X the price listed on the menu.  I asked the manager on duty why there was a discrepancy and he went behind the bar, got some cash and gave it to me.  Now mind you, it was of course, no where near the amount I was overcharged but I guess it relieved his conscience.  He handed me the money and said "It will take me too long to find out who your server was and look up the transaction, so here you go."  Unreal!  Food was average to below average and prices for what you get were a real rip off.  Original style broth that was recommended was so chock full of pepper you were downing water all night - if you could get a refill.  Save your money and time - go buy a fondue pot and do it at home.  You do all your own cooking here anyway so why not.  Will not return.  Hope this saves others a bad experience as well.
I've written complaints on here as well as sent the melting pot an email about my experience the night I dined here...and they have yet to reply to me or offer any sort of compensation! NEVER again.

Made a reservation a month in advance for 7, noting that it was an anniversary dinner (and hoping for one of the curtained off couples tables.) Called the night of and asked if we could change the reservation to 7:30 since we were running late.  We were informed that we could not and that we needed to make it within 15 min of our original reservation in order to be seated.  We rushed and made it right at the "cutoff" mark, and were seated at a huge table, I assumed because all the couples tables were full.  After getting settled in, we looked around only to find the restaurant dead empty.  We were one of maybe 5 parties there.  Why the rush?  Would have given only one star if not for the great food, and having plenty of leftovers for lunch the next day.  The server was quite attentive, so I think it's just the hostess desk that's not up to par.

Note; this will be a long meal so plan accordingly.  You can't do this place quick, its an experience.

I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. This was the second and final visit to this establishment and I will be sure to make sure everyone I know does not waste their time or money. For starters, the lights were so bright, we had to put the black cloth napkins over the light pendants. When have you ever been to dinner where the lights were too bright...seriously, they were painful even to my 82 year old father.  Then at 8:00pm when my dad asked for a coffee refill we were told they were out of coffee.  In Scottsdale, AZ they were out of coffee!!!. When I spoke to the Asst. manager Emily about this, she couldn't be more rude or more uninterested.  Where are we?  The food is average at best and  after 3.5 painful hours and a $400 dinner bill I was done. Time and money not well spent...do not make the same mistake we did!!

What a scam.  Stay away from this place.  Tried to get reservations for 6:30 Saturday night, was told on 3:30 available.  So, we took the 3:30.  (4) of us for dinner.  We were actually there until 7:30(4 hours of slow, slow, slow service).  Restaurant half full.  

To make reservation, had to guarantee $35 cancellation fee per person. Only told after they took credit card information when booking reservation.  So, could not cancel.

Arrived on time, got seated on time.  Handed the menus and saw they had only a special Valentine's day menu.  $69.95 per person.  And a limited menu.  Okay, so if we cancel, we lose $140 (4 * $35) or we stay and take our chances.  Didn't find out until afterwards, but on their website, Special menu is listed under "Specials and Events), click a couple more times and you find their Valentine's Day special.  Not on the main page of their website under Menus and not told when booking reservation.

So, rather than cause a scene, we stayed.  What a mistake.

Service was horrible.  Probably one of the worst in the valley.  Everytime the waitress came by, she had to interject herself into our conversation with her experiences on the subject we were talking about.  Who cares what she has to say.  Not to be rude, but if we wanted to talk to the waitress in depth, we would have invited her to dinner.

Then, she couldn't remember anything.  Had to remind her several times to bring the wine, the champagne.  And clumsy.  Nearly dropped a pot of hot melted cheese on my wife.  Missed, but got the floor.  Yummy.

The setup of the tables is equally bad.  Everytime the temperature on the stovetops had to be adjusted, you have to move your chairs so the waitress can reach under the table to adjust the setting.  Really.  Who thought that up.

And the food.  Basically overpriced boiled food.  Super salty.  Not much taste.  I get fondue, but something about boiled meat just seemed off.  

So, you order the appetizer(s), 2 to be shared.  4 people share (6) tiny pieces of bread.  A couple of pieces of salami, summer sausage.  Probably 50 cents worth of ingredients.  The melted cheese wasn't bad, but not great.

Then the salad.  Kidding me right.  Nope.  So small not even sure why they brought it out.  And basically some greens covered in average caesar dressing.  

Main course of a chicken potsticker, a couple pieces of raw chicken, a couple pieces of beef and some veggies.  The best part is "boiling" the meat and chicken in broth.  

The dessert was passable.  Hot chocolate fondue with the absolute smallest piece of banana you can imagine.  2 strawberries, a piece of carmel cheesecake, an ice cream dough thing.  I think I have seem the same at Costco for a couple of bucks for 100 of them.

But, you can have all of it for $140 per couple, plus tax, plus an automatic 20% tip.  Then the last joke of the evening, a place on the bill to put additional tip.  

Ranks amongst one of the worst dining experiences ever.  Bad service, mediocre food, way overpriced.

And to enjoy the experience even more.  The wife gets to spend a good portion of the following day on the throne (you know what I mean).  

Called today to tell the General Manager about the experience.  Could not talk to him and he was way to busy to talk to a customer(not any more).  So, told the assistant manager about the experience.  Basically called me a liar and that the experience from beginning to end could not be the way I described.  And then the best response every from a restaurant.  "So, what do you want me to do about it".

Absolutely nothing.  That's why we have Yelp.  Because Yelp listens.

Don't eat at this place.  Not worth the trip.

This is one of my favorite chain restaurants - and I don't like chain restaurants.  This is a fun place for a date - it has the potential to be quite romantic (just be sure that the person you're bringing along is worth the time, effort, and money).  All cynicism aside, cooking your own morsels of food, though time consuming, is a great way to get to know your date.  They have an extensive wine list.  You'll be spending a lot of time with your server as they prepare cheeses and desserts tableside, so be chatty and be polite.  Try the Coq au Vin cooking style which gives you a nice pot of Burgundy wine and spices in which to cook your food.  This place is a great destination.  Be prepared for a big night on the town!

Why is this place still in business? My husband and I have no problem dropping a couple hundred dollars on an excellent meal, but this just didn't cut it. It is outrageously overpriced for what you get. Our waiter wasn't very knowledgeable and the menu was confusing. Apparently there is a fundraiser menu, but it's the new menu, but you can order off the old menu, etc.  Plus, you have to cook everything yourself. I know that's part of the experience, but the reality is you probably don't know how to cook meat in broth or oil. It is either under or over cooked, there's no seasoning, and it takes forever to cook one bite at a time. If you order the oil (for a $7 surcharge!) they bring you batter to tempura your food. Every time my husband tried this it came out a slimey grey mess. If you're absolutely set on going here, save yourself the money and disappointment and just get the cheese and chocolate. If you want to have an awesome celebratory meal, steer clear of this place and go somewhere like Steak 44 instead. We can't stop talking about how disappointing the meal was, especially with $190 price tag!

Yes, The Melting Pot is more than some people can afford but the experience it totally worth it! I have been begging the hubby to take me there for dinner and one night and he finally caved and took me, the service was excellent and the food was amazing! I definitely want to go back someday!

Went to this place last night with my girlfriend for the first time. First walking in, the place had a low-key, romantic mood. The staff was very friendly and we were seated promptly. We were seated in a private booth that was accompanied with a curtain and dim lighting. Our waitress was very knowledgable and we found out it was her first night working the floor. She seemed like she had been working there a very long time. Bottom line for this review:
It's a date place for couples. There is a process for the four course meal which is time consuming so do not plan on a quick sit down to eat. You pay for the dining experience which is exciting and very sensual. The wine is great and the food is delicious. Book your reservation ahead of time as walk-ins cannot always be accommodated. I don't know how people can rate this place less than 5 stars. Even the price a bit steep but well worth the food, wine and experience with your loved one.

We go to this restaurant every birthday and celebration because of how fantastic it is.  It is a little pricey, but the food is amazing, the variety of things you get from the cheese to the chocolate are something we look forward to for months.  The variety of items in the entree and all of the different sauces make this so individualized. It takes a little longer than most meals because of cooking the food at the table and all of the courses, which makes for a great night of conversation and connecting.  This has been my favorite restaurant for years, and continues to be.

If you know what to expect in a fondue restaurant this is an excellent place. Much better service than the other locations in Az. Our server was friendly, nice and made the visit very pleasant. Ask for Mike D in your reservation comments section.

So we went in on a groupon and I just want to say I was impressed with such amazing service. So many places treat you different when you use a groupon. I just wanted to say that our waitress was outstanding serving with a smile and being extra attentive to our table. It was just my husband and I out for a Friday night date trying something new and this surpassed our expectation immensely! I cannot remember our server's name but she was truly great (: Also The manager is so genuine he was walking around talking with everyone including my husband and I. It was just such a great vibe and kicked off a great night for us!

The dinning experience here was such fun and totally delightful and delicious.  Our server, John,  was very friendly, informative, and helpful in every way!  I would highly recommend this place to anyone.  Everyone here was very concerned as to whether all was going well and even the owner and manager checked on us.  All in all a very wonderful experience.

I decided on The Melting Point as my choice and phoned the restaurant to place the reservation. The guy taking the reservations could hardly be heard or understood. we could not get water on the table for a good 20-30 mins and had to ask the neighboring waiter. Piss poor service with mediocre food.

I always love going to The Melting Pot, especially for special occasions. Their servers are experienced and friendly and the food is always perfect. When I went to The Melting Pot the other day, however, it was interesting to see a balloon man walking around entertaining the kids. I had to ask myself if I was at Red Robin or a nice restaurant that I am paying a decent amount for. While trying to enjoy my dinner, I kept hearing "Do you want a lion, a hat, or a sludge hammer?!" This was a little disappointing and put a bad taste in my mouth. The next time I decide to go out for a special event and spend a good amount of money on a meal I might consider going somewhere else.

My 3rd time to Melting Pot and still loving it !!! 

It is all about the EXPERIENCE ... 
Went with a group of friends for birthday dinner and had their 4 course dinner and averaging an hour per course .... 
So do set aside plenty of time and tummy space to enjoy each of the course. The 4 course dinner will give you the full fondue experience but it is indeed a lot of food.  From the cheese fondue, salad, entree, dessert, everything is absolutely delicious and the dessert is totally out of the world. If nothing else, everyone should at least come try their chocolate fondue .... they have happy hour for a very good price
And if you are up for a early dinner or a very late dinner, they have special for $35 for 3 course meal. But I think they have some restriction on what day it is offered, so check ahead. 

Overall, wonderful experience, great services, awesome conversation spot, and fantastic food.

Finally got to try their happy hours .... it was as good as I could remember ... and for $5.00/person ... you cannot beat that .... the only thing is that they have only couple of spots .... so come in early to get your spot

Of course you cook your own food is FREAKING FONDUE! Any one that complains about that has no idea what fondue is. We went here on are anniversary and I loved it they have it dark to set the mood it's  intimate  romantic. Yes it cost I pretty penny we ended up spending around 150 for the two of use that included some of the best drinks! The service is nice they try and leave you be like ninjas refilling your drink.
Great anniversary dinner. Justifiably recommended by our friends.  Lovely and decadent. We loved it

Well tried to go out to dinner with my sister, nephew and son.  I had won a gift certificate before the new year for Peters in Scottsdale.  However hadn't had a chance to go. We went all the way out to McCormick Ranch and the place was closed down.   I checked on the net and nothing there said they were closed.  

We live in Peoria and were starving, so we decided to go to the Melting Pot since they opened at 3.   We had 45 minutes to wait before they opened so we decided to wait since we were already in the area.  There were only two parties there there besides when the doors opened. The hostess asked if we had reservations and we said no.  She said that was ok and said she was going to seat the other two parties first because they had reservations and then seat us.  That was ok.  We waited 10 minutes and the manager came out a couple minutes later and asked if we had reservations.  Again I said no.  He said well it would be 20-25 minutes wait.  They only had 2 servers and it wouldn't be fair to us they wanted to give us all the attention we deserved. I tried to explain we had already waited 45 min for them to open, we came all the way out from Peoria and the other restaurant was closed down.  The manager could care less.  He repeated they only had 2 servers. I said you have got to be kidding me and he looked at me like I had 4 heads.  I said this is ridiculous and walked out.  

I'm sorry but it must be nice to be able to afford 1 server per table (a party of 5 and a party of 4).  There was only two tables filled in the whole restaurant.   Pretty sad when a server can't handle more than one table at a time. The manager was a total jerk and needed to go back to school to be trained how to treat customers. 

I will never go there ever again.  I hope no one else does either.    The only reason I gave it one star is because you can't post without it. They deserve zero.

After two extremely disappointing trips to the Melting Pot in Ahwatukee, I was hesitant to try the Scottsdale location. I had some dip certificates that were about to expire, so I decided to give them another try. 

I am so glad that I did. Not only was the food amazing, but the service was excellent. Michael D. was the server, and he was friendly and professional. There were two managers walking around to make sure that everyone in the restaurant was satisfied, and I was very happy to honestly say that it was the best experience I've ever had at The Melting Pot in a long time. From now on, I'll only come to this location. If Michael is still there the next time I visit, I will definitely be asking for his section again.

I'll keep this short. The food is good, the ambience is good and the entire visit is an experience like any other. Go there with time on your hands, go there with people you have plenty to talk about with as it takes a while. This is a place to relax and enjoy being served and eating food which is so different. If the price seems prohibitive, go for the happy hours.

Staff was all very friendly. Food was good. Probably a little expensive based on the portions, but it's a unique experience. Pace of the meal gives you plenty of time to talk, so a good date place.

I checked in on YELp and was supposed to get a free box of chocolate covered strawberries, but they were out of them. A little surprising since our reservation was for 6 pm.  

Staff was good about it. Comped me the value of the strawberries, but should probably have more available at that time of night.

Overall, I'd recommend.

My wife and I went here on Feb 11th at 9:30pm hoping for chocolate fondue. We made reservations on Open Table. When we got there the hostess told us that they had "tried" to notify us but that they were only serving a special Valentines menu at $79/person. We already had dinner with friends earlier so we were just looking to finish the evening together with chocolate fondue. But they claimed there were no other menu options other than this "special" menu. I get that there could be special courses for Valentines Day. But they told us this only at the door, having driven 18 miles, at 9:30pm, and with no other choices! Classic bait and switch! 

If they had really wanted to get a hold of us, our reservation had both my phone number and email listed. Instead they tried to ambush us at the door with this special menu hoping we'd have no other option but to eat a second dinner at $79/person so we could also have our dessert. They bait and switched us hoping I'd avoid the embarrassment in front of my date and just accept their terms. But my date was my wonderful wife who agreed the whole thing was a sham and we didn't need to be insulted so we left and instead had a wonderful dessert at the Cheesecake Factory. So beware, they may not tell you up front if you make your reservation online but if you're going for Valentine's Day on the 14th this special menu is also in effect and is the only choice that evening. After this experience, we'll be choosing other places for dinner or dessert.

We went here for my birthday during Restaurant Week.  Made reservations a few days in advance - there was much confusion about the end date of restaurant week and informed them we'd be celebrating a birthday.  

We waited about 15 minutes past out reservation time to be seated. No mention of the birthday we had informed them about.  We informed our server that we'd never been there before or to a fondue restaurant and she just smiled and walked away.  We had to ask her repeatedly what to do as we were given no direction. We were very disappointed in the service.

The food was fine - we did add the coq au vin, which was a flavorful sauce of fresh herbs, mushrooms, garlic, spices and burgundy wine.  The desert was good as well (you can't go wrong with chocolate)!

The meal does take about 2 1/2 hours to complete and is a bit on the pricey side.  We are glad to have experienced it, but would not return.

This location is really hit or miss. We tried it a couple of times and once was ago and the other was AWFUL. I stated very clearly that I was allergic to mushrooms and they still brought them to the table. It was taken away but there was some kind of contamination because I was sick as a dog the rest of the weekend. Ruined our whole weekend and we will never be going back.
I save the Melting Pot for special occasions, and of course it would not disappoint you.  It's classy and the service is great.

Tonight we had the pleasure of dining at The Melting Pot in Scottsdale.  We had the spinach dip fondue, California salad, endless dinner, and chocolate fondue.

Our meal was AMAZING!

The manager, Emily, was so sweet and took a complimentary photo of us, as well as stopping by to check on us.

Our server, Jason, was attentive and helpful!

We will definitely be back!

My husband and I just celebrated a belated Valentines dinner here last week and LOVED it.  It was his first experience and he wants to go back again.

Of course we cannot go every week or every month considering that it costs a pretty penny.

The service was awesome, the food came out quickly and everything was mouth-watering.  The drinks took a little long but I think it was because he also brought the cheese fondue at the same time, either that or the bartender was slow that night.

If I could give this place 10 stars, I would! We've been here a few times but last evening we took our girls there for a birthday dinner after swimming with dolphins down the road and they were chilled. We asked if they had any shirts we could buy. They didn't but they did have long-sleeved uniform shirts. Not for sale, though, but they just gave them to us so that my girls were comfortable! Don is an amazing server. So nice and the food is incredible. My only regret is that we were so "drunk" from the chocolate fondue that we forgot to take home our doggie bag! Love you guys!

Interesting dinning experience I had at The Melting Pot in scottsdale tonight. We were greeted at the door and brought to our seat. The atmosphere is dark and quiet with soft music played in the background. We were then greet my our waiter and took our drink order. We have been to this Melting pot over a couple dozen of times but it has been sometime since we have been back and let me say this will be our last trip there. The waiter informative and attentive to our needs. The first course we had the Santa Fe cheese it was delightful with a beer base and salsa cheesy goodness. As we continued to our main course of Sirloin, chicken and potstickers everything was going great, until my daughter felt something crawling on her leg. Low and behold it was a roach that wanted to join us for dinner. The others in my party including my daughter freaked out and got up from the table, we went to find someone to help remove the roach which took a while which was strange. Once they removed the roach we all sat back down and I looked under the table again and sure enough there was another roach. This time the Manager came over to collect the roach, the strange thing was her never apologized he just calmly said "oh geez, well thats Arizona for you" he then proceeded to leave the table. Needless to say we all lost our appetite, so we pretty much wasted a couple pounds of meat. I didn't want to continue with the desert but since it was my daughters birthday we decided she would be sad if we didn't get a birthday desert. While we were waiting for our desert the Manager came over again and asked us how the food was and strike up some small talk, never apologizing for the roach that decided to crash our dinner. The desert came we chose the Yin and Yang, it was white chocolate and dark chocolate swirl. The dippers were good but like i said earlier everyones appetite got ruined from the previous course. Heres the thing I expected some type of apology or even them comping our desert, instead we paid for the bill and left. I will never be going back to the Melting pot the food is mediocre at best and the atmosphere is strongly uncomfortable. Our waiter was good but Im surprised that the Manager was so strange about the whole roach issue.

I saw a someone praise this place on Facebook and I started chuckling. My wife asked me to go with her to the melting pot a couple years ago. She was very excited until the food actually came. That's when she said, this isn't what we ordered. I said yeah there is less then 4 oz of meat to share between 2 people. She said, no I meant these are the wrong sauces. I said hang on. We are paying 120 dollars for 2 cups of raw vegetables, 4 oz of meat, and beef stock? She said well your paying for the ambiance. Plus desert is to die for. Desert came, she said Isn't this great and I said we are dipping less then a cup of fruit in chocolate. At the end she said you hated it, didn't you. I said baby I loved being there with you, but I have never paid so much money in all my life to eat every day food and stay hungry. For the same money we could have gone to any number of nice restaurants and actually had a full meal.  My wife laughed and then said yeah your right. It's a great little niche restaurant idea, but once you get past all the hoopla this is place is a huge rip off.  On the plus side, It's a nice romantic place with super dark tables. Cooking your own food gives you plenty of time to sit and talk with that special someone.

My daughter was in a group of 17 kids going to dinner for prom.  Although she said the food was good; the service was not.  They had a 6:30 reservation and did not get out of the Melting Pot until after 9:30; which means they did not arrive at prom until 10:15.  They missed the whole prom basically.  Not happy to spend that much and they know they have a dance to get to and they take that long.  Kids were disappointed!

A very unique place specializing fondues.. This is my first try, everything went like I expected, but not outreaching... We had the Fusion version of the Big Night Out  four-course meal.. A lot of food for two, and not cheap!

1st course - Fondue A La France
It was a-ok.. the cheese mix was great, but the white wine (don't remember name) base was too strong... I wish they'd use less of the alcohol. But you get unlimited sides with it..

2nd course - Salad Nicoise and California Salad
Both salads were tasty! However, the plates arrived in an ice-cold condition, and by looking at the presentation of the salad, I felt it was already pre-made and came out from the refrigerator.. the leaves just don't look like were just mixed together...

3rd course - Main entree with Court Bouillon cooking style
The fusion version offers one extra item, a lobster tail, other than that, everything is the same from the feast version. Meat and seafood were fresh, wish that I had chosen a different cooking style, maybe the Bourguignonne, didn't really enjoy the vegetable broth, personally think the taste was too strong..

4th course - White & Dark Chocolate Fondue
This was my fav!!! The mixture of two kinds of chocolate was just right, adding the different toppings for dipping, cheesecake, strawberries, bananas...hmmmm... If only it has less calories, I'll never have enough!

The whole dinner took about 2 hours as we're fast-eater and didn't really spend that much time on the cheese fondue...so come prepare for a long stay if you want to experience the 'whole package'..
This was an amazing experience. It cost more than anticipated and the waiter might have been having a bad day, but would highly recommend.

If you go here, you will enjoy a four course fondue meal. The desert chocolate is awesome. I prefer the 'Smores' option but the others look great also. They have many options for the main course. This place is pricey and you do have to cook your own food, but a nice option for special occasions.

Best fondue experience, hands down. I've always loved fondue, but until going here, I never knew it could be so delectable. The seating is very private and intimate, and the mood lighting really adds elegance. As for the food - delicious and satisfying. Also, our server was uncannily timely. He always knew when to serve the next course, haha. I wish I could remember the name of him - he was an excellent server

The only thing I dislike is the price. It is, quite frankly, outrageous. Especially, since you're basically cooking it yourself. My friends and I only go here on VERY special occasions - because the check was an occasion itself.

But above all, wonderful food, wonderful servers and hosts, wonderful atmosphere.
It is always a treat when we go out to eat as a family. We just had desserts but SO MUCH FUN!  It is a great environment and impeccable service!

Came with my fiance (his first experience) and we both absolutely loved it. Very friendly staff from the host, to server, to manager. I was taking a selfie and a worker walking by (not our waiter) offered to take the picture for us. Service was great, food was beyond amazing and all around ended our anniversary perfectly.

I went to the melting pot for the first time for valentine's day with my boyfriend.  It was delicious!  Our server was incredible.  She was very attentive to our needs and made us feel like we were her only guests that night.  I noticed the manager going to every table and thanking them for choosing the restaurant.  Talk about personalized service!  They have these special enclosed booths that have a curtain.  It is defintely a romantic spot.  You have to have the artichoke dip.  It was the best I've ever had.

Mary was our server and she was great. The cheese fondue was great and we loved the cool dippers! We appreciated the manager Tony stopping our table too. 
When Mary brought out the chocolate and the plate said Happy Anniversary-well that was super cool! Thanks Mary for a great night as we celebrated our 30th anniversary! We will be back soon.

I am SHOCKED to see any negative reviews here. Our experience was amazing! We visited last night for our 7th wedding anniversary. We had previously visited the location in Santa Barbara, CA for our 2nd anniversary and Columbia, MD for our 5th. We are no strangers to TMP but this was our first visit to an Arizona location. It did not disappoint, in fact, my husband and I agreed it was our favorite visit to any TMP yet. 

Our server Kayla was wonderful. Polite and friendly, she also had perfect timing and went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. The food was delicious, as always. I'm not going to go into too much into detail on that because you can check out the other reviews for an in-depth food description or the company website. We also enjoyed a couple delicious cocktails and AZ craft beers which my husband loved. 

Is it expensive? Sure, but it's well worth the splurge! Look, maybe it's not some people's cup of tea. Some people would rather just go to a boring steakhouse. We go for the EXPERIENCE and the Scottsdale location delivered. We will definitely be back!

What I love about the Melting Pot is the whole evening is centered on making a meal and sharing the experience with family and friends. It's a wonderful culinary experience that keeps drawing me back!!
We have a great time, everything was delicious, the dessert awesome! We had a great service by Mike. Thanks for help us have a wonderful night

We went to this place just so the kids could have some fun desert. I had been there a couple times before my kids were born (about 10+ years ago) and i thought we had a good experience, but things have changed now - for the worse. Place seems to be frequented by the rich old scottsdale clientele that arrive in their mercedes's and don't mind throwing 100bucks on what i would say is - mediocre food - and whats with being attended by snobbish waiters. We had one that barely showed up for taking the order, we could not get water on the table for a good 20 mins and had to ask the neighboring waiter - who also seemed to forget us - only when we called another waiter across the table did we get some water. The way it works is - you get a bunch of fruits and cookies and other dippers that you can dip in a bowl of molten chocolate. When the waiter showed up - he reminded us that if everyone on the table had a plate, we would have to pay 9$ each. I am not sure why he said that - as if we would not be able to afford it or something. I know the desert is overpriced  - but i m there with my family to have a good time. Take the order and bring back some food - and should not be too hard to smile when you do that. Anyways, he took the order and disappeared. Showed up after a while and had two plates - i was like - i just ordered food for all on the table - why skimp? i did not make a fuss - we still made sure the kids enjoyed and i still paid him the 20% gratuity- which he did not deserve. Piss poor service with mediocre food. Sad. I don't generally give out reviews, let alone bad ones, but i was not happy here.
Every time I've gone to this location, the folks are very sweet and attentive. Food is always consistent.

My husband and I like to go Melting Pot to have dinner always. Everything was great so far. However, we were extremely disappointed with the food that they served yesterday.Yesterday we chose the special offer - Endless fondue. $36.95 per person. 

The filet mignon was not fresh at all and it has strange smell. I guess this was the worst filet mignon that i ever had in my life! The teriyaki marinated sirloin and prawns were great at first. However, when we asked to refill the teriyaki marinated sirloin and prawns, you can tell that those quality of the refillable sirloin and prawns dropped significantly. I guess those refillable food are cheap/sales stuff. I actually have the pictures with me. 

We have spent $111 yesterday but was extremely disappointed with the food quality. I was thinking to give feedback at their website but I couldn't as I have forgotten to take the receipt with me and we need to fill in the receipt number in order to give feedback to the Melting Pot website.  I will never tried their ENDLESS FONDUE again as I do not want to eat those lousy food. I like to go to the Melting Pot BUT i think i will STOP going as i cant believe that they served bad quality food to their customer at the moment. I was thinking to tell my friends to try this ENDLESS FONDUE at first. However, I would tell all my friends NOT to try their ENDLESS FONDUE now. 

I Hope that the Melting Pot will take note of this issue and please don't serve your customer with2nd/3rd grade food when your customers are willing to pay. I do not know the reason behind why you served bad quality food... Is that because of the price is cheaper or because of the business is not that good during this summer and you have tons of food in your freezer which are not fresh?

I don't normally write Yelp reviews, but my experience at this resturant was so bad that I feel I must share it to warn others as to what to expect.  
My sorry experience was as member of group that had the misfortune to chose this place to celebrate an event.   There were seven of us and we were enjoying our selves laughing and having a good time.  Apparently this doesn't fit with the business model of this restaurant.   As a result we got into an argument with the manager and walked out on 300 dollar tab. 
This restaurant is pretentious and overpriced. Avoid this place, there are a lot better restaurants out there.

The entire experience was great until a cocky waiter decided to keep all my change and take a well over 20% tip. The manger didn't seem to really care and once the issue was brought up he took 10 minutes just to come back with my change. The waiter (josh) was attentive until he took the tip then he made sure not to make eye contact.

I used to love the Melting Pot years back, but when I tried it again more recently, I couldn't remember for the life of me why.

The reason for my 2 stars is for the poor food quality. The only thing saving my review from one star is the comparable atmosphere and the concept. The concept is really fun, I mean, who doesn't like fondu? The cheese dip was just mediocre at best and tasted like something I could make at home by just melting down some cheddar cheese. The salad was nothing special and the meat/seafood wasn't a good quality. My biggest disappointment was the filet as it was super tough and fatty. Unfortunately, I expect more for the prices and my experience there left much to be desired.

As a 44 year old college educated female I must admit I mad a very poor decision in my restaurant selection . Very disappointed in our dinner tonight. I have waited over 20 years to do this dining experience and should have waited 20 more years. Went for our  21st anniversary tonight and was shocked to know that you get a boiled dinner for $50 per person with lack luster flavor.  They provide all types of sauces and herb butter etc to add as your seasoning and garlic salt mix seasoning however they did nothing for flavor.


Not a fun and interactive experience at all. 
I had done my research and looked at their website online and read reviews and thought this was going to be a nice dinner. To me cooking your dinner is not
boiling filet mignon, chicken and shrimp in broth. That's just wrong! 
For vegetables, celery, carrots, broccoli and bread quite surprised
on the choice of cheap vegetables to accompany the cheese.  Then only white  button mushrooms,boiled red potatoes and more broccoli for steaming in broth as our vegetables with entree. Just very sad. 

I have eaten at many restaurants and this is the first review I have ever
written to warn others. There are many places to  enjoy a dining 
experience that is romantic other than this. I have no problem paying 
for a meal if it is worth it and this wasn't worth it.  Now I see why 
people frequent this with Groupon offers and don't pay full price. 

Truly the only food that should be boiled is a crab boil. During the 3 hour meal.. The highlight of our dinner was when we both visited the restroom and to each of 
our surprise we said the best part of the experience was the nice
cloth towels to dry your hands.  My husband agreed ... and read my mind
I guess after 21 years of marriage I am lucky he knows me so well.

We marked this off our bucket list tonight and he even came home to tell
the kids it was BAD and he has never done that !   I told my husband we should have gone to IN and Out for this  evening's dinner and would have had more fun.

You always have a choice please chose to go somewhere else and not
make the mistake we did.

For a quiet and slow dinner, go here. The atmosphere is really laid back, the price is a little high but the fun behind going out for fondue helps. It has been a long time since I have been here, it might be time for a revisit to see what I think of it now.

We used to be fans and just living close sometimes just having cheese and dessert at the bar. Most bartenders are fun and appreciate the little extra fun we provide as well as being decent tippers. 
Got here today to an empty bar and looked around - relatively empty dinning room and were told only chocolate at the bar. No you can't have a table and we won't feed you at the bar. Even the new bartender was cavalier about it. 
When June rolls around and you are begging for locals, count us out. What would it hurt to feed us a cheese pot.

First time at the Melting Pot. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary. Romantic setting. Food was great. Servive was great. Even the manager, John, stopped by our table. Impressive. We will go back.

Went here with a group & had a fun, yummy, first time experience!

First of all, the bartender was great!  He made the perfect lemon drop & margarita! *yum!*

The staff was very friendly & told us what do expect & what to do.

Loved the choice of waters that we had on the table.

The interaction (cooking) was fun and something different.  From dipping veggies into different pots of hot cheese mixes, to cooking meats & shrimp shabu shabu style, to dipping fruits & desserts into different chocolate mixes (our fave!!)

I would come back for the dessert part, for sure! Oh and the drinks!!

Over all, a great time and some yummy food.

Dear Reviewers reading,
I been to the Melting Pot in Houston so I thought this one will be good here, I mean its located in a beautiful expensive town but the service here wasn't all that amazing. my group and I got the endless fondue special going on, the food was amazing nothing wrong there it was our waitress although she was so nice to us she was slow. I ran out of my drink in the beginning and she even came a couple times to change out things and didn't notice my glass was empty sitting there. I didn't want to beg or be rude and tell her "Hey my glass is empty" so I waited to see how long she noticed, which after coming a total of 2 times she finally noticed it and got me a refill. Then the time after that she noticed and said she would be back with a refill when she came back she forgot it, until the manager was making his rounds and saw my cup empty and asked what was I drinking? I was surprised he noticed right when he walked up but not her. I guess trying to watch 3 people was a little too much for her. I didn't get rude or tell no one I wanted her to do her job that's all. Other than that problem everything was amazing.

My husband and I went here last night, and I gotta say it was disappointing.
We went for the 4 course meal which was incredibly average, especially for the price! 
Our server was slooooowwwww and not attentive at all, they kind of stick you in this corner booth then forget about you! Wouldn't go back, spent $100+tip on a meal with tiny portions and crappy service.
This was our first experience at the melting pot.  It was an awesome experience.  Anthony was our server and he did such an awesome job and provided great service.  We will come back soon

This was the second visit to the Melting Pot thinking that the food and service would be better the second time. Wrong! The service was terribly slow with the drink order alone having taken 25 minutes. The food is grossly overpriced and the quantities extremely small not to mention that some of the vegetables not being fresh. Their deserts are interesting however, should not be the reason to be a destination eatery. We will not return as price vs value and quality does not exist. And it seems they really do not care.

We just finished our meal here and it was amazing. Our waiter Logan was super nice and was very helpful when we wanted to order something. The food was great. Loved how we had or own small space to cook our food. Overall the whole restaurant was great would recommend.

We celebrated our 21st anniversary here last night.
It was pretty pricey for the quality of food we received.
We ordered the ahi entree and the vegetarian entree.
It is obvious the restaurant is geared more towards meat and shellfish entrees.
Our server was attentive and the chocolate turtle fondue with accompaniments was our favorite part of the meal
While it is a little pricey - it is a great place for a slow date or lots of conversation.

Everything was very good...no complaints from us! I only took a star off bc our server took a while to clear our dinner plates. I came here with my bf bc we were celebrating our anniversary :) 
We started with the cheddar cheese fondue...seriously yum!! 2nd course was teriyaki sirloin, chicken, pork and filet. We choose the Mojo broth and it was very good.    Dessert was the milk chocolate fondue and the extra decadent plate thing (cheese cake, cream puffs, etc...seriously get it....you won't be sorry!) 
We'll def be back!!!
Love it, I go every year for my Birthday...great service by Emily and hostess was quick to seat us, manager came by table to greet us...love the cheese fondue !! And chocolate !!

ok so, first of all, if i had known we had to cook our own food i never would have gone here. second of all, the cheese was good but not $16 good. the food was ok, but if you get something different from your date you still share the same pot so the flavors get all muddled. plus, the lighting is very dim in this restaurant so it was very hard for me to tell if my pork, chicken, shrimp and any other must be fully cooked foods were fully cooked. i must say, their curry sauce was amazing, and so were the chocolate covered strawberries, which is why i'm giving 2 stars instead of 1. i will not be back to throw away close to $100. i can go to ruth's chris and have an amazing meal for that price. i'm very disappointed.

The company I work for booked The Melting Pot for our holiday party this year, and we all had a great time. I am rating it 3 stars because although I didn't have to pay, I think the value may be questionable for what you get.

First off, the staff was amazing. Having never had fondue in a restaurant setting before, they were quick to explain each and every thing on the table. They were quick with all requests, and they kept the wine flowing and the tables cleared off. Their attitudes were superb for the affluent area the place is in.

The first course was an introduction, with a blend of melted cheeses bubbling away on our table with an assortment of breads, vegetables, chips and even granny smith apples to dip in and sample. This was probably my favorite part of the meal. Next came a salad, which I enjoyed, but found it unremarkable. The main course consisted of a sampling of various meats and seafood: chunks of steak, seasoned beef, seasoned chicken, mini-stuffed pasta medallions, prawns, and a lobster tail. This was partnered with various veggies including mushrooms, potatoes and broccoli, and a variety of dipping sauces, with of course the hot broth to cook everything in. My favorite part of this course was the seafood dipped in the herb butter, and the gorgonzola dip. Last was (naturally) the famous dessert course, with chunks of brownie, cheesecake and fruit with pots of milk and white chocolate to coat it all with (the cheesecake and marshmallows was the highlight). 

While I did think everything was OK, I didn't think it was something I could have gone the rest of my life without trying. I could see this place as impressive for a date or significant anniversary or event, but there are far better "fancy" restaurants with more flavorful offerings. Even though we were in a large group, my wife and I got a table to ourselves, and that "date night" feeling really works well with this place. Another good aspect was that we got our pick of everything presented while everyone else had to share. 

One of my favorite things to eat is shabu shabu, and while similar in execution, I think the Japanese version of cooking-your-own-food is far superior. I'd gladly pay the premium for shabu shabu, but The Melting Pot just isn't my thing.

Service was awful! The greeting from the manager is "Can I help you?"...ummm, I'm here to eat something (stopped in for happy hour). When they run advertised specials the staff is completely uneducated about the details. 
When I was younger this was a place for special occasions, but the patrons at this location looked like they we hanging at a drive thru. 
The overall quality has really gone down, I think my relationship with Melting Pot is officially over.

The Melting Pot is an interesting and unique place for a meal, but certainly is outrageously overpriced, otherwise I would give it an even higher rating.

The cheese fondue really is out of this world. And the desserts are also nothing short of amazing. I wasn't too impressed with the main course however and that part of the meal especially does little to justify the price.

The service here is quite good and the waiters could probably even afford to give you more alone time than they do. This is a place I would definitely return to for a special occasion, because it is a nice experience despite the price.

My BF decided to surprise me with The Melting Pot experience for our anniversary..I've always wanted to try it and have heard great things from friends.  The Melting Pot definitely did not disappoint! Our fondue aficionado, Kayla, was genuinely nice and made this special night one to remember.  We had the spinach & artichoke cheese to start...Yum!!! Especially on granny smith apples and the pumpernickel bread pieces. The California salad was pretty good, the dressing was REALLY good and the meat and veggie portions in round 3 were perfect. It doesn't LOOK like a lot of food, but trust me when I say your tummy knows the difference! Perfect portions. Last but not least...DESSERT! We had the turtle chocolate...O.M.G. it was heaven on a strawberry, rice krispie treat, pound cake and especially the brownie! The price wasn't too shabby as we did a special for about $40 per person, but heck you're paying for the ambient experience.  Thanks Kayla for making our anniversary one to remember.  We will be back!

Last night I went to The Melting Pot with three girlfriends for a special "Girls' Night Out" event that they marketed. There was a set menu, and the price was $29 per person with a few options for $5 martinis. If you wanted a drink that wasn't on the set menu, you paid extra. 

When we arrived, we were greeted outside by two very bronzed girls who were promoting Planet Beach tanning salon. They gave us as many samples as we could carry (for those of us who wanted tanning lotions and such) and had a entry form for a free month of tanning.

We had reservations for 6:15, so we were seated promptly. Our waiter, Cody, came over to introduce himself and explain how things were working that evening. When we asked about the other activities outside (we had seen girls getting paraffin dips and hand massages and eyebrow waxing in the courtyard), Cody told us that we could participate after dinner. Angela, our friend who made the reservation said when she called they told her we could get those services until 10 PM. So, we relaxed.

We ordered our cheese and cooking options and then some drinks. The drinks took forever to arrive. Seriously. We had almost completely finished our cheese fondue by the time the drinks arrived. 

The cheese option we selected was a spinach and artichoke white cheese concoction that was delicious. But isn't anything with cheese delicious? :-)

There were several times when we complained (to ourselves) about our lack of drinks. Later, when one of our friends said she would want to order another martini in about 5 minutes, our waiter said, "I should probably go put it in now, though, considering how backed up they are." We thought, 'Oh wow, they are really busy with this promotion.' Turns out they had no glasses. In fact, the Ahwatukee location had to run over glasses for Scottsdale. I thought it very odd that the restaurant would advertise a big Girls' Night Out event and not be prepared for ladies wanting drinks. Oh well. 

We choose the basic bouillion cooking style, and our plates contained sirloin, filet, chicken, shrimp, butternut squash ravioli, and an assortment of veggies. It was a ton of food! We were not expecting to get so much at the discounted price. 

Our chocolate fondue choices were limited to milk, dark or white. Three of us were up for dark and one wanted white, so Cody was nice enough to bring her a little bowl of white chocolate. We had a ton of dessert .... And it was delicious.

Meanwhile, a woman from Mary Kay came over carrying a basket of what looked like presents. She asked us if we had heard about the drawing yet, and we said no. She said, "OK, well, I'll just leave these entry forms here with you." And, she did. But, she never told us what the drawing was for .... and she never returned. She asked us "Does anyone have any Mary Kay products in their purse." One of my friends did, and she got "a prize" - one of the presents. Then she asked us, "Does anyone have any lipstick at all." We all did. We all got "presents." Our present was a bag of marketing materials, which was kind of a let down. 

Next, the bill. This got a little weird because there were additional charges on our bill that didn't make sense to us. We paid with three credit cards, and all I know is I was charged $6 more than I should have been, and my friends who had either higher priced drinks or multiple drinks paid less. We asked the waiter about some of the charges, and apparently one of the drinks ordered was not on the set menu and was therefore extra. Though, we had asked about making an adjustment and he never said it would be more. 

We excitedly went to the courtyard for our treatments and discovered that everyone was either gone or was cleaning up! And it was still early! That was a bummer ....

So, overall, the food was great, and it was so nice to connect with friends over a leisurely dinner. The price was perfect - about $40 a person when you consider drinks and tip - and if they do another such event, I will go again, but try to arrive early to make the most of the activities.

We took friends visiting from France to the Melting Pot last week.  The experience began very nice besides getting past the sort of odd smell when you walk in the door.  The bartender seemed to be out of his element as he took one person's and then made the cocktail ..took the next person's order then made the cocktail....one at a time ( it took us 20 mins to get our 7 drinks ) then when we were seated it took a while for our waiter to greet us.  Our waiter was nice and knowledgeable.  During the course of our dinner we discovered some discrepancies and when we brought the items to the attention of the Manager he was professional and courteous and absolutely made the situation right.  We will return.
Great place for an entertaining dinner. It is expensive but the food/experience is wonderful. Dinner took a solid 2 hours.  I used to think fondue was only cheese....

Worst Melting Pot in The Country. First of all, we do The Melting Pot every year for Christmas Eve for the past 15 years. 7 years in Dallas, TX, 7 Years in Denver, CO, and now our first year in Scottsdale, AZ.  I have also visited in Atlanta. Food is consistent with every other Melting Pot we have been too.  Problem is service, wine list, and beer list. Worst wine list of any restaurant I have ever been too. Very disappointing for us because we always look forward to a bottle of Jordan, or stags leap, or cake bread, etc. none of these available. Service was awful. Slowest I have ever seen.

Concern I have is that this melting pot seems different than any other I have been to. I asked management and they stated ownership is trying to do things different.  May want to reconsider and listen to your customers first.  Perhaps Gordon Ramsey could come do a kitchen nightmares episode here!

We will find a new Christmas Eve tradition.

We waited to be seated in the empty restaurant in spite of having a reservation. No explanation, no "it should just be a few more minutes", nothing. Not a deal breaker but still a poor start. 
I gave two stars because our server was sweet. I wish we could turn back time and get our $300 back. All of the the fish was fishy and the vegetables were not fresh. (Maybe I prepared my food wrong?) The food seemed really low budget with a terribly bloated price tag. 
The kids thought it was fun but we still won't return. My overall feeling about the whole dinner was "ick".
Fun concept, poor execution. The food was horrible plus $200 for two people! Plus the four course meal took 3 hours. Save your money and dine elsewhere.

This was my first time at the Melting Pot and it definitely won't be my last! The food was delicious, our server/waiter Jeremy was extremely nice, accommodating and explained everything we needed to know, making the experience all the better!  Plus, ending the night with a classic chocolate fondue was just the icing to a perfect meal.

I love melting pot!  Great place to celebrate anything.

It is great for kids too. We celebrated my son's 12th birthday and he loved it.

My six year old daughter and I enjoyed a fun and memorable date night at Melting Pot last night. It was her first exposure to fondue and we had a blast eating great food and talking about her first three days of first grade. We starteed with a fantastic spinach and artichoke fontina & butterkäse cheese fondue, then shared the "Land & Sea" (filet mignon, chicken and shrimp). Of course, when the dessert menu came out so did a bit more enthusiasm. She had never dreamed of seeing a pot of melted chocolate before. The looks on her face were priceless. She chose the "Cookies 'n Cream Marshmallow Dream" and it was crazy good. I'm looking forward to taking the whole family and to making this a more common stop on our date night calendar.

Well where do I start.. We went for 2018 Valentine's day. Bought the $124 dollar package thinking it was gonna be awesome.  Which included 5 course meal. 6 roses. Curtain seating. $25 gift card. Bottle of wine. Couples picture and frame all in a Valentine gift bag. Was sat for our 8pm reservation and had to wait 15 min just to order. We got our drinks and food ordered($8 for 12oz can beer that the waitress brought to the table and opened in front of us) B.S! Took forever to get our meal. Waitress keep saying " sorry for the wait I'm just slammed"
Got our food . THUMBS UP to the back staff for great preparation . Fast forward 3 hrs later and got the bill for $350 bucks. Curtain seating that was crapped and very small for 2. Did not get our bottle of wine. Did not get a picture or frame of us. Did not get $25 dollar gift card . We were so pissed from this experience.  We will never come here again and I WILL tell everyone I know, not to come here. Go to a McDonald's and a Motel parking lot. cheaper. Lol
Oh ya. 2 stars for back staff and the dessert
Otherwise  negative -5 stars
First time but not the last. Dinner takes awhile as your pot heats up for each dish but the food was really good. We both did the 4 course with the chocolate dip dessert. Soo good!

This place was amazing! The staff was friendly and informative and the food was delicious. Our server Ashley (not sure if that's the right spelling) was sweet and friendly, she even asked if it was alright if she used us to train a newbie first, which was very considerate. The newbie, who I forgot her name, did a spectacular job even though we could tell she was nervous. My only complaint was that the prices were insanely high. I wouldn't recommend going unless you had a coupon or are prepared to pay at least $30 a person. I also felt a little under dressed, but that's not the restaurants fault. Everything else was good though, and I will return in the future!

Very impressed by the management here. I should have posted this a few week ago when it happened, but it was good enough that I remembered it that much later. 

We're not sure exactly what happened, but when our server wasn't fully keeping up with everything the managers stepped in to complete our orders (with the all of the adjustments we were asking for), and helped keep everything going smoothly for us. I'm sure some management may have just left us to sit there waiting, but they stepped up and made sure we had a great experience.

The Melting Pot is a dining EXPERIENCE. If you get a private booth, it can be a very romantic dining experience. 

Heres the deal...As mentioned in other reviews, the food is good but not amazing (except for dessert!). Set aside a good 2 1/2 - 3 hours for dinner, drinks and conversation. It takes a while. If you are one of those who likes to order, eat and get the hell out...this is not the place for you. Be ready to relax, have a few drinks and take your time. The cheese course, salad and main course are there as distractions. The spotlight is firmly held on the dessert course! Its freeking amazing!!! We haven't had a dessert at the melting pot that we didn't LOVE!
We love Melting Pot and come to this location 2-3 times a year. We go for the wine flight and highly recommend the Gorgonzola fondue! Check out their weekly special events.

This was our first time here. Our waiter was great and the food was really good. The manager Nick showed us excellent customer service and made our dinner memorable. Highly recommend this place and applaud the staff for their attention. We'll be back with friends and family soon.

Were here on a weekday for happy hour in May '13 between 5 to 6 PM. And were greeted, seated in bar. 

Bartender was pretty good and suggested options. We tried Cheese Fondue & choc. Fondue, which was good...

Would try this place again :)

We celebrated our 6 year wedding anniversary last night at the Meling Pot and had a wonderful experience.  It was our first time going and they really did a great job personalizing the experience.  We had a card and flowers waiting for us at our table and the wait staff all congratulated us on our celebration.  That doesn't mean much if the food isn't good but it was deeee-lish!  We had the Big Night Out and was able to customize the menu to our liking.  Although the main entree wasn't much more than a glorified hot pot at a Chinese restuarant, it was still awesome.  You can't go wrong with dipping your appetizer in melted cheese and your desserts in chocolate.  We would definitely go there again!

Pretty delicious! The melting pot is always one of my favorites. The service is always great (Ashley didn't disappoint during our visit yesterday). The food is consistently delicious. The quality is good but it's up to you to prepare it correctly. My one complaint and the reason I gave 4 vs 5 stars, I was charged $39.95 for the endless fondue but the website and the manager informed me that it'd be $36.95. It's only a $3 difference but, hey, that $3 could have covered my coffee.

This is a great spot for a date night.

We had a table right next to the fireplace.  
Our server was slow at first, but very kind and a lot of fun.

The food was delicious.  We had a cheese fondue, salads, and an endless meat fondue.  Keep in mind this isn't your typical restaurant.  You don't go and get served ready-to-eat food.  You get served food that you cook in the fondue pot.  If you're OK with that, this is a lot of fun.  It can get a bit overwhelming keeping track of cooking times, but it's worth it.

We regret not getting a chocolate fondue for dessert, but we were way too full.
Restaurant week is a great deal at the Melting Pot!  Always a fun meal!

Not impressed at all.. The food took forever to get to us and way overpriced. You will need to take an entire evening to eat here. Just seemed really overpriced for cheese and prepped food that I cook myself. I gave it 1 big Fon-Don't..

Went here tonight for dinner for AZ restaurant week, very good choice. The whole process takes about 2 hours but it is always nice to just relax during the meal. Both my boyfriend and I decided to get the cheddar cheese fondue and the bouillon fondue for the meats. Both very good. We also got the house margarita and a strawberry lemonade. Very good portion size for what you pay for and the slow pace of it makes so that you get full. We noticed that service was suuuuper slow though to get our main meal, but our server took the liberty of taking care of our drinks because of the wait. Great service! Hoping to be back soon to try the happy hour!

This was a great experience.  There were 7 of us for dinner with different dietary needs and they accommodated everyone.  John, the Assistant Manager, called the day before to make sure he had everyone's menu needs correct.  The service was outstanding with Emily our server making sure everyone was happy.  Great place for special events.  This was truly a great dining experience.

Was alright. I think places like the Melting Pot are more about the experience than the food itself. Which makes sense, you always hear of people taking their wives/husbands, dates, here. Definitely not a casual place where you hit up every Friday, though I wouldn't be surprised if that market of consumers existed too.

So we ordered four different land meats and/or seafood items. They were alright. The reliance on dipping sauces to make the food taste good is a little unsettling but a classic hallmark of American cooking it seems.

nice food terrible service. Can't even get a second spoon! Rude waitress and manager. She came by to tell us off because we asked for extra spoon veggies and bread . We have been here about 30 times. This was the worst service ever!

The food here was awesome! The staff was very respectful and helpful. The seating in this restaurant was very intimate. It did not feel like we were having dinner in the same building with a bunch of other people.

Reason: my birthday celebration late last year (December)

Service: thoughtful, friendly and helpful 

Cool points: cozy ambience, great place to commemorate special occasions, on the romantical side  

Food: the bf loves hatch chili so our starter cheese fondue was easy to choose and it was pretty yummy. We went with the seafood option because I was wanting scallops and they paired nicely with the sauces provided, they were tender and buttery. Of course, the dessert is truly the sweet ending of an otherwise savory dinner. We opted for classic dark chocolate that did not disappoint. The server brought the plate and stuck a bday candle in the brownie, that was a nice touch. 

I will definitely return, they have a pretty fabulous happy hour though I have never been.
A little over priced and the quality may be good but the entertainment is what we all come for.  Cheese and chocolate.  Yes please

First off, this was the BEST dining experience! My wife and I ate here for Valentine's Day. Our server Nick was friendly and down to earth. He made the night even better for us with great service and meaningful conversation. 

The food was so full of flavor, the salad was surprisingly good. This is coming from someone that hates salads! The meats have such distinct flavors! Writing about it makes me want to go back! Oh my god, the dark chocolate with Heath toffee! With all those great desserts to dip them in! Amazing!

I had a slight hiccup in making the reservation, but the manager in the red sweater vest took care of us. He was very kind and accommodating. Good people work here!

My wife wants to know if we can get toast to dip instead? Ha! The white bread was ok, not great. That was the only thing! So GREAT work!

The service was good. However, this place seems tired and dull. This place used to be very popular not anymore.... overpriced with small portions. I have been going to melting pot for years and the last few visits make not want to come back. We got the alpine fondue which reminded me nothing of Switzerland. The awful wine overpowered the cheese make it almost not edible. Meat fondue portion was pretty flavorless. And the chocolate fondue which always should be win... was lacking with various dippers such as packaged rice crispy treats (those cheap ones in blue package). These should be homemade. Will not be back for the cost and food quality lots of other great places to eat in Scottsdale.

Awesome experience !! Have been here numerous times but tonight was the best experience yet. The food is always what you expect but the service was much different tonight. Mike, who was our server did a phenomenal job taking care of us. His customer service, pride, and product knowledge is the best I have seen in a long time. If you end up going to the melting pot for dinner, and if you want the ultimate experience, please ask for Mike. You will not be disappointed.

Everyone needs to do the Fondue experience at least twice in their lifetime right? My first experience was dining multiple times at another place in Northern California where they allowed you to cook with a grill. Manager says the chain is testing this concept, but since my fondue grilling took place  over 10 years ago, it seems that they are woefully lagging behind the times. You essentially have to boil your food and if you want a more flavorful experience go for the mushroom broth which of course involves an upgrade fee of six bucks.
    Join the Club - Get 6 free chocolate covered strawberries to go 
Prices - Just order one entree for two people and without drinks, you can get out for $60.
Food - the cheese fondue was a bit bland, but the chocolate berry crunch was a tasty end.
Dippers - Order the upgraded desert dippers for $5 and you get some good dipping options including cookie stix, cheesecake and better berries.
Main Course - Well the house salad was bagged, but the sweet dressing was drinkable good.
  We got the entree that is most popular and most meats were pretty good/seasoned with the Teriakyi steak and shrimp stealing the show. Somehow, also the broccoli was great too after soaking up all the soupy broth. Lots of garlic involved also in all items.

The booths were private, the server was nice, the manager checked on us twice and they gave us that special happy Anniversary plate. They do a nice job of making you feel special and most people are celebrating something, but next time will check out the Happy Hour where you can do fondue a new and cheaper way.

Excellent for romantic occasions or with a group of friends. Prepare to take your time though it is something that you don't want to rush through. Each course is fun and can be interesting. But what  I love the most is their wine selection. They have a few of my favorites. Definitely worth the experience.

Things started off unpleasant which is really hard for a restaurant to bounce back from, in my opinion. The host had major attitude from the moment we walked in and seemed annoyed she had to work. That set our happy, excited mood to a very sour one. Thankfully the manager Emily came up and took over since I had accidentally moved the reservation to the wrong date when updating the number of guests and the host wasn't being helpful. The only other big negative was that the printer wouldn't work so we had to wait 30 minutes at the end of our meal before we could pay and leave. It was late and we were ready to go but I can't blame a restaurant for that, it's out of their control.

On to the POSITIVES!! Our server Holly was great! She was super friendly, knowledgeable, and had a great personality. She did announce the wrong nonprofit when she first told us about the menu however the manager mentioned she was new and that the beneficiary was still the correct one (we are volunteers for the nonprofit receiving a portion of the proceeds this month). Holly also came back to check on us periodically which was nice so I could order a second glass of wine.

I hadn't been to a Melting Pot in years and the food was really fantastic! There were lots of great choices and we started off with the Spinach Artichoke cheese dip and that was great! The proteins with our entrees were also quite delicious and it was fun to make our own meals. We chose the Smores dessert and that was definitely the highlight of the meal! Very tasty and I can't believe how much they give you to dip in the chocolate fondue.

It's worth going here for something different. Had there not been a screaming toddler near us and a friendly human at the host podium, this would have been a higher rating. Ambiance includes hiring friendly, welcoming employees. I've worked at many high end establishments when I was young and people make or break these restaurants.

This is a great place for a quiet romantic night.  I have been to the Melting Pot only twice and both times it was this one up in Scottsdale.  The first time we had a full dinner which was fabulous and this last time we only got desert.  The desert was at a great price and we walked out of there an hour or so later, feeling relaxed and full of chocolate fondue for only 25 bucks.

I really enjoy this place, but if you're a chocolate fan, be sure to save room for desert because it is to die for.

I travel each and every week of my life away from my family, so I tend to explore the area to find fun places to eat.  Fondue seemed like a natural choice for fun!!  

My friend Zach and I stumbled in to The Melting Pot on a random Tuesday early in the month of July and it was LADIES NIGHT!!!  How fun!  The manager was so kind as to offer the special to both of us...even tho one of us was not a lady.  The fondue was amazing.  Salad fresh.  Cheese course was wonderfully cheesey...and the meat/chocolate courses were amazing.  I can't use another word to describe everything except for amazing!  the biggest surprise of the dinner was the restaurant manager Ivars Melbardis!  He came over to our table, thanked us for coming in and inquired about why were were in town and how often we would be back.  He asked that we come back in and see him again if we get the chance.  We also were impressed with the server when we couldn't agree on the flavor of chocolate because one of us wanted the one that they light on fire and I wanted one that didn't come with the fire show.  The server brought out the one that didn't come with a fire show and surprised us with a little flaumbe action!!  It was great!

What lead me to write this review is that we came back to town, my co-worker Stephanie and I and hit up The Melting Pot for dinner on Father's Day.  We tried to go somewhere fun in honor of our husbands that we were forced to leave home because of our work schedule.  Not only was the food just as wonderful, service top notch, but the manager again knocked my socks off with his wonderfulness!  Ivars not only remembered me from last time, but he e offered us beer samples from local breweries, told us the best places to eat where we can get them on tap and gave us gifts to take home to our husbands.  How kind is that!  You couldn't ask for a better manager.  It is his engagement that will keep me coming back to his restaurant.  Thank you for thinking of my husband even tho he couldn't be there!!

I am rating this 4 out of 5 stars because it is really pricey, but keep in mind, that does come along with a great experience. 

This is a really cool place--awesome atmosphere and an overall unique dining experience. I went with some friends for a "girls' night out" special they were having and I had a great time! 

I have heard a lot of comments from other people (not on Yelp, but from friends/co-workers) about "why would you pay so much to cook your own food?" Well, that's kind of the purpose of this place and what makes it fun and distinctive! 

If you plan on going to any Melting Pot location don't expect to get out of there in an hour. The whole process takes about two to three hours, but it gives you plenty of time to catch up with friends and not feel like you are being rushed out of there. 

I know it changes on different nights, but when I went this is how it was: first there is an appetizer portion. They give you different cheeses to choose from for the fondue Next is the main course with different meats and veggies. Lastly is the desert part. I think the desert itself is the best part for sure. It's a little smaller portion than I would have hoped for, but it was really tasty. They had three different chocolate types to choose from: white chocolate, milk chocolate, and dark chocolate. 

I love this place and will definitely be back, hopefully sometime soon!

My best friend is a Melting Pot Groupie.  It is one of  her favorite places on earth and when a Groupon popped up, she persuaded me to give it another shot.  (I had been many, many years ago and while we enjoyed our meal, we thought it was overly expensive.)  

Our meal started out with a waiter who was clearly having some issues.  After being seated and mentioning our Groupon, you could almost see his face fall like we were The Table Of The Unwashed.  "Oh.  That's a different menu.  I'll go get those," as he whisked away our regular paying person menus and hoped that we would not choose to trim our toenails at the table.  

Shortly afterward, my bestie asked for the manager and explained that our server was providing a less than stellar (and I'm being generous here) experience.  To his credit, the manager apologized and replaced our server with one who seemed to enjoy her life.  

Beyond that, it was a lovely evening.  The waitress was friendly and engaging.  The food was good.  The drinks were good.  When the bill arrived, I still felt it was awfully expensive (even with the Groupon) given that we were cooking our own food.  I enjoyed myself but I will say that it's just not my thing.

I went to the Melting Pot with my husband to celebrate our wedding anniversary. the dining experience is good. Honestly, I loved the melting cheddar cheese and the food was very delicious. The salad was fresh. What i did not like was the waiter..he was not very friendly. Another negative point is the waiting time. We stayed four hours in that restaurant because we cook our own food:) I want to add that the dessert was great as well
I totally recommend it if you do not mind sitting for 4 hours in the same place:)

I went to the Melting Pot with my mother, 7 year old daughter and boyfriend for my 37th birthday and it was awesome! This is such a fantastic place to have a nice dinner with people you care about. The food is amazing and the service is great. It took 3 hours for us to complete our 4 course meal. We chose to do the all you can eat style 4 course meal which includes a salad. We were stuffed!! I'd recommend this to anyone looking to have a great meal and spend time with people you care about and enjoy.

The host greeted us with how can I help you with a straight face... in a dine in restaurant . I thought it was an odd question. I had to wait few seconds before I answered him . He was looking at us as if we were aliens. Anyways , then he told us that we had to wait 20 minutes to get seated in an empty restaurant. I got a very cold vibe from him . Never going to that location again .

First time being here and looking forward to come back ! De li ci ous food and what a relaxing atmosphere ! We were very welcome and our waitress provided great service! We invite you to live this experience!! Best way to start weekend!
