I've seen this restaurant all over the country but never went because I thought it was pricey for what you get.  Fortunately, Deal Chicken offered a $100 4-course meal and a bottle of wine for 4 people. Definitely worth the experience for that price. 

First of all the building and all the neighboring stores are dark at night. Not a very inviting complex if you've never been to the area.  However, the interior is decorated and set up very nicely, typical of a traditional steakhouse.  Be sure to ask for table with dual tops if you want to try different fondues. Kind of silly to force 4 people to agree on one item imo. 

Since we sat at a double stove, we got two cheese fondues, everyone had a house or ceased salad, then we get two entree hot pots (mojo and regular), then two desserts (we had yin/yang and bananas foster).  Overall the food quality was very good with a few misses. Bread pieces were cold and stale. Cake/cheesecake were dry. The house wine was pretty awful for this caliber restaurant, but I guess it never claims to be a wine place.  I didn't have problems with the filet as some others said. I was actually surprised by how tender the meat was. Other endless entrees were chicken, teriyaki steak,  shrimp, and a vegetable ravioli. You get to request as many refills of the entree items as you want.  Sauces were great and changed up each bite.

It's a fun and interactive meal. We spent 3 hours total, which I wasn't expecting so don't be in a hurry afterwards. Service started good but then she disappeared somewhere after the 2nd course.  

Overall: I wouldn't come back at regular prices.  Maybe just for dessert if you want a romantic date. Or simply have someone else pay. =)

Great place for a very leisurely dinner. Seriously, it's gonna take 3 hours so I hope you like who you're with!! 

NOT GOOD FOR FIRST DATES. 

When I'm there I usually get the dinner for 2 with whoever i'm with - cheese fondue, salad & meat courses. Then we're STUFFED with no room for dessert. Here are a few alternatives I've found:

1. Go in and order individual dinners, not the dinner for 2 thing. This way you each get a meat course (I think it comes w/ salad too)  and then you will have room for dessert. 

2. Go in JUST for dessert. (This is my favorite thing to do with my sister - it's great girl time!) Have a very light dinner at home or wherever and then you can sit and eat chocolate fondue yumminess and drink good coffee. (They have great coffee). I also highly recommend the espresso martini.
Great food, drinks, and service. Fiesta Cheese and Flaming Turtle are the best cheese and chocolate fondues!

This is the perfect date night, girls night and celebration type of restaurant. The ambiance is on point, the staff is always so nice and really enhance the experience. There is absolutely nothing that I do not love about the Melting Pot especially at this location. I have been coming to this restaurant regularly for awhile now and never once have I had a bad experience. Lastly, I will say I do appreciate the fact that management always comes over to ask how the experience has been and they seem very genuine inside of doing a quick drive by and not even bothering to make eye contact like so many other gm's will do. This is a go to spot!

Bought a DealChicken special for our anniversary...Super happy!!

This was a terrific dining experience! Ambiance is romantic and quiet. The staff was attentive and helpful to use first timers. 

I have always wanted to do Fondue but hadn't until now. I wasn't disappointed! I read the Yelp reviews before hand, so I had an idea of what I was walking into. No surprise that dinner took 2 1/2 hours. But we were celebrating and I LOVE the company so no complaint! Celebrate we did! Our waiter was super in guiding us through the experience and helping us decide what flavors. Everything was really tasty! There is a seasoning that is called Garlic and Wine that they serve as a seasoning and we brought ourselves home a bottle and use it on all kinds of stuff, but mainly our salad. It was a good deal for only 7.98.

In conclusion, I don't really care to have my meat basically boiled so I wouldn't be a regular...But I will be back for the cheese dip and dessert portion of the meal. My honey on the other hand had no problem with the entire dinner and looks forward to returning.

My boyfriend brought me here for a reservation at 9pm on September 3rd for my birthday. It was my first time experiencing the place and I loved it! The drinks were delicious, the food excellent, and the price was what I expected. Our server was Dallas and she was absolutely wonderful! This girl knows how to make her customers feel welcomed and relaxed! And she was fun! 

Thank you for a great birthday, Melting Pot!
The melting pot is a classic spot. Awesome experience and better service. Tyler was our server and took care of us - she was great and made our dining experience very enjoyable.

This is probably the most expensive restaurants I've ever been too, but it's sooooooo worth it. Everything was delicious and the service was amazing. It was fun getting to chill my own food and it's set up in such a way that is almost impossible to ruin your meal. Every bite was better than the last. I took my wife here for our anniversary and they brought our dessert dippers on a "Happy Anniversary"plate.

I can honestly say I've never had anything that taste worse. It was comparable to airplane food. I'm definitely not a fan of cooking my own food - but that's not why this is getting 1 star. I get that's part of the experience, just not one I enjoy. The steak was absolutely tasteless and the cheese was just bland. I really wish they'd put better ventilation in the restaurant as well because the smell of all the burning pots was enough to kill my appetite. Worst food I've ever had. Ever.

Let me say first off, that I'm a cheese lover. Daughter of tried and true New England types, there aint nothin' better than extra sharp Vermont cheddar or my Swiss brother in law's homemade fondue. So when my now-unfortunate ex and I got pregnant 3 weeks after the blissful wedding event, we went to The Melting Pot to celebrate. It was a repeat visit and I've more recently been to the Phoenix location [Ray Rd]. I echo the reports of others: alot of money, alot of time and not particularly genius. It's a nice 'experience' . I think its okay fondue, I'd pass on the meat course and since liquid chocolate isn't really my thing, I'd just go for the cheese course. 

Given that, I can stay home and make my own Welsh Rarebit and wait for the next time my brother in law is in town and save myself some serious time and money.

This is more about experience than food (in my opinion). Don't get me wrong, the food is good but its WAY expensive. Me and friends went and had a great time and if you've never done the fondue thing, you should try it sometime.
Amazing dinner experience! Jason explained and prepared our 4 course fondue dinner. He and the manager, Emily were very attentive. We will be back soon! 10/10.

Every now and then you want to treat yourself to something fun and different. The Melting Pot does a great job in doing just that. This is not the place for those looking for a quick bite to eat, instead dinner is served at a leisurely pace that you gives you plenty of time to enjoy your food and your company.

I've been here many times of the years. When you can get a Groupon or Living Social deal, grab it! Dinner is pricey but the experience is worth it. Tonight we had the four course meal which was a cheese fondue, salad, entree, and chocolate. We started out with the Gorgonzola and bacon cheese fondue which comes with bread, veggies and apples to dip in it. Cheese and bread....DELICIOUS! I couldn't get enough. The second course was a salad. I had the house salad and my husband had the Caesar. They certainly weren't the best salads we have ever had but they are decent. For the entree I had sirloin, chicken and shrimp and my husband had a Cajun platter with beef, chicken, shrimp and sausage. Tonight we choose the mojo cooking method but there a several other choices and they are all pretty yummy. We finished off the meal with the s'mores chocolate fondue which came with a platter of fruit, brownies, pound cake, marshmallows, and rice crispy treats. The chocolate really is the best part.

We passed on the cocktails tonight but have enjoyed them in the past. The drink menu is definitely worth browsing.

My daughter took me here for my birthday and we had a wonderful meal!  I LOVE fondue!  For two people they offer the 4 course for one price (all you can eat), and it contained all the different fondues we love.  

The nice thing about eating here is it requires conversing.  So many Americans today don't sit and enjoy a meal and talk.  As cooking fondue is a process, you go from one course to the other in a relaxing and enjoyable style.  It is a little dark in there, but it provides for an intimate ambiance.  

The staff was fantastic.  A little slow the night we were there, but they didn't treat us like it.  Everyone wished me a Happy Birthday which was really nice.  Service was awesome, fondue was perfect. 

This restaurant provides a relaxing ambiance that is perfect for a special meal. I would recommend.
This was such a wonderful restaurant, my fiancee and I had the most romantic and fun time here. Highly recommended for a date night! You will not leave hungry!!
Michael was an amazing server and deserves a raise for sure! Made us girls feel special and very well taken care of! Will definitely come back again soon!!

This a cool experience.

A very romantic setting with low lights and you can sit in a very separated booth from everybody else.

The waiters are very nice explaining everything very well.  I had never had experience with fondue and I greatly appreciated that explanation.  The photo, later on in the night, is a nice touch. 

Pricey.  It was like $90 a couple.  That's just for the basic four course meal... doesn't include the wine or anything.

Plan on being there for 3 hours.  A very nice time when you are with someone you love and just enjoy being with them.

I'm hoping to go back soon.

My wife and I went for a date night and we had a wonderful time! Our waiter Jeremy was funny and charming. He suggested great options for us to try and we loved them all! The manager was super friendly as he stopped by our table to check in. We will definitely go back.

I went for AZ Restaurant Week. The wait staff were incredibly nice and really take a lot of time to explain everything if you're new as week as the cooking process. They were very willing to make dietary substitutions. Be prepared for a long meal though. I only had 1.5hrs and even with a reservation, I had to quickly stuff my face with dessert in order to make it out of there a little over 2hrs. So don't go unless you're prepared to sit down for a while. The atmosphere is ok. It's very romantic so if you're going with friends and just want to talk and laugh, it might not be the best place. The food was alright. I don't think it's good enough to justify the prices, especially since you're making your own food. Save your money, go buy a fondue set and do it at home. But it's definately worth the experience on time. I just personally will not be going back.

I'm a big fan of the melting pot my husband and I go here every year on out anniversary and it's really a fun experience! The food is amazing and the service is even better, With the private booth of course! I would recommend everyone try out and I'm sure you'll enjoy it

Our waitress, Amanda was FANTASTIC! She was attentive, super nice and we had great conversation with her. Emily on the other hand is the wicked b*tch from the west! Her sass and lack of eye contact is less than desirable when dealing with a manager. I felt like she wasn't listening to me but instead looking everywhere else in the room. Furthermore, when we asked for additional dippers for our chocolate she wouldn't bring them out but we have had them every single time before. Amanda definitely smoothed things over and we will be back again solely because of her grace and class. In fact, she should be made the manager! In the future I really hope to not see Emily at all.

My daughter chose this restaurant for her birthday dinner. We were very pleased with the experience. The waiter was helpful and efficient. I find it overpriced so I would save this place for special occasions only. Or when someone else is paying.

My wife and I love to have Fondue and this place is probably #2 on my list all time of great Fondue spots. The private booth for two with a curtain was fantastic and a nice surprise. 

The quality of the dippers was great too, and I actually got more than I expected. Some fondue spots like to limit each meat selection to three pieces at most, but I was happy to see 4 or 5 pieces of the meats. Not the shrimp though, strictly three shrimp for the classic and the cajun entrees. 

The service was just right. Not bothering us too much, not leaving us hanging for the whole meal. 

A couple of negatives. Not the end of the world, but noticeable enough to comment. What does it take to get some light in there? I mean, Edison invented the light bulb in 1879. Seems like this place got left in the dark. So freaking dark in there I really could hardly tell which piece of meat was cooked and which wasn't, let alone tell the difference between pork and chicken. Also, they went a little short on both the cheese, and the dessert chocolate. We have quite a few dippers left and the cheese or chocolate was gone. I've been to quite a few fondue joints that had plenty of cheese or chocolate to spare and the wait staff was asking if we wanted more dippers. 

Overall a good experience though.

Amazing dinner! My husband and I did the St. Jude's donation dinner which was a four course meal. First set was the cheese, we had the delicious spinach and artichoke dip. Along with a house salad, which was delicious. Then we had delicious surf and turf along with ying and yang dessert. It was my husband and I's first wedding anniversary and they decorated the private booth with flower petals, it was beautiful!!

Went to the melting pot for my husband and I's wedding anniversary a few weeks ago. The service was good the food was tasty, but now I remember why we don't go very often ..because it is so darn expensive and you cook your own food!! It was nice to have the photo of us that they took as a memento, however that was the extent of the anniversary goodies. (They have an anniversary package that they make you pay extra for which we did not get). The restaurant was also super dark inside. Probably won't be going back anytime soon since our bill was well over $100.. Yikes..

Fun experience but pricey.  You are given raw meat to cook yourself.  If you have kids (or if you are having wine), you worry whether there is enough concentration to make sure the meat cooked enough.  I did not like the clove sauce they cooked everything in.  Great place for desert though...go just for that!

Having a ying for a taste of Switzerland.. I decide to celebrate a special persons birthday here.. Kind of to remind her of Europe.. well.. the price reminded me of Switzerland.. but the authenticity isnt there.. AND they have a menu that says a Alpine Nite.. dont be fooled.. most cheese fondues do not have grainy mustard in them.. We did the price fix menu.. starting with the cheese fondue.. a salad.. the meat and seafood course.. (a small amount for two considering the price was about $45 each).. chocolate fondue.. with too much amaretto in the chocolate.. the experience is cool.. but if youve been to Switzerland.. dont go in here thinking your getting authentic.. my advice.. hit up Sur La Table and get your own fondue pot.. do it at home.. and youll get more authentic.. am I snob.. proudly..

My wife and I went there to celebrate her birthday recently, and it was phenominal. Everything was incredibly delicious, and there is a sort of entertainment aspect as the wait staff preps the cheese and chocolate at your table. The protein portion puts you in charge of your food prep to an extent, as you sqewer, dip, and time the cooking of the raw protiens in the oil fondu. We found it to be a delicious and entertaining evening! Be prepare to spend about 2.5 hours there if you are eating all 4 courses, but the time flies and is enjoyable throughout.

Wow...I mean what more can you say?! Last night we celebrated our 4-year anniversary and throughout our 2-hour stay we couldn't stop saying how this place exceeded our expectations. When we arrived we were seated promptly in a private corner away from everyone else by window doors with real and fragrant rose petals on the table, and we were lucky enough to watch a thunderstorm roll in which made the night even more romantic. I think our server's name was Jennifer? (Jessica? Sorry but she was amazing! Give this woman a raise! She's so funny and laid back! haha) We had never been to the Melting Pot before but it's so true when they say it isn't just a dinner, it's a dining experience! It was so neat the way she prepared all the fondues in front of us...Everything was flavored so perfectly and I'm all about trying new things in my own kitchen so it was fun and relatable. Again, the shrimp and steaks and veggies were SO TASTY. We opted to get the wine infused broth...worth the extra money because it kept our corner smelling good all night and I myself like cooking with wine. ;) I also got a couple Love Martinis to go with it...seriously the tastiest martinis I've had. They're usually so strong and bitter but these were enjoyable and refreshing....To end the night we got smores fondue and our plate of treats was decorated with a cute little candle that said "Happy Anniversary" which was really nice. There was never a time where we were just sitting there waiting for our next course or for our drinks to be refilled...everything was so timely you'd swear they'd have someone monitoring a camera at all times like Go go go hahaha!!! Overall we cannot say enough great things about our experience and we will be coming back with friends! Thank you so much to all the staff and our server who made us a priority! You guys rock!!!

Well... I'll start positive. Atmosphere is great, service was great, and overall the food was good.

That being said the price is far too much in my opinion. I'm  a ok paying for good food and classy dining. However we were in a large group and I felt like the portions were equal to what two people would normally get although we had at least 3-4 around each pot. (Also to mention folks in our group who'd been there before said the portions were no bigger than when they went as a couple) 

I would go back however I'd most likely go for some drinks (all reasonably priced) possibly cheese and dessert.

While the Melting Pot is a chain, the service we received at this location was amazing.  We arrived later in the evening and Ralph was our waiter.  He did great with assisting a very indecisive group.  His humor meshed well with ours and he kept us laughing all evening which really added to the evening.

My Beloved's birthday is always both an exhilarating experience for me; as well as, a journey back to the date of when my one and only love was born on this earth.

Hence, the trouble I go through to spend the entire month celebrating such a significant date. And picking the right place to celebrate is certainly a key component to successfully celebrating this auspicious event.

I had made these reservations weeks in advance, and reserved a booth. 

I paid the added fee to prepare the booth for her birthday. That's the reason why there were visible rose petals in the pictures, which were strewn over our table in a decorative fashion.

We ordered the 4-course experience, which opened with a delectable combination of fresh vegetables, meats, and delicate croutons. When dipped in the cheese filled pot, the accompanying mixture made for heavenly introduction to our meal. The cheese wasn't too overpowering.

Then came the salad, which tasted fresh and crispy. And the house dressing added a wonderfully delicate balance. 

Afterwards, the mixture of meats and seafood arrived. Steak, Chicken, Shrimp, Lobster, and Ravioli. By now, the cheese pot had been substituted with a new pot that had a special broth to cook the meats and seafood in.

This is typically where the negative comments regarding the lack of flavor stems from. The Bouillon, even though it is advertised to be full of flavor, can be emaciated (weakened) by the cooking (and boiling process). The food, when boiled at the prescribed duration, still doesn't quite allow for the mixture to seep into the meats. It comes off as being bland. 

What we did was cook it much longer than prescribed, and this allowed to the flavors really sink in. We discovered this early enough in the process, and it truly improved our overall experience with this cooking process.

After the main course, came the dessert. We had the pure chocolate, along with the sweet additions. This came with cream puffs, berries and other delectable items, that when dipped in chocolate, would send our palates soaring! Sublime and Divine are not enough superlatives to describe our palate's experience.

As noted by other seasoned reviewers, the Melting Pot Fondue experience is not as authentic as that which one could experience in Switzerland or France. I couldn't agree more, since I, too, have enjoyed Fondue in both those locales. 

However, as far as this local interpretation of a cuisine 9000+ miles away.

I believe that they've done a marvelous job of creating a fabulous representation. 

Without the long TSA lines, and an even longer plane flight that detracts from this moment's experience.

Certainly the moment, and the meal that we both experienced, were unequivocally unforgettable.

Late night, post graduation celebration. The physical restaurant seems rundown and outdated. Short staffed as we had to wait quite awhile between courses. I think it's over priced for the amount of food that is served. We did two cheese dishes and for 6 people had a small wooden platter with small amounts of bread, vegetables and apples. We had to keep asking for additional food, then it would take awhile for waiter to bring out more. 2nd ended with chocolates and same scenario. Took over 1 1/2 to eat and pay, seemed very slow! Just very chintzy!Glad I tried it but not sure I'd go back.

A niche dining experience that is essentially met for people who actually like one another.  You're sharing boiling pots of cheese and chocolate while "cooking" for one another.  This isn't a spot where you're on your phone.  They literally have private seating options with curtains where you can get all sorts of weird with one another.  If you're a miserable failed abortion that probably ate their sibling in the womb as the first step in their quest to become the most obnoxiously gluttonous racist in all the land, then your name is probably Todd "El Jefe" H - and El Jefe probably should have just asked for a table.  We all get it man.  Your gargantuan self couldn't fit in the booths.  It's ok.  We know that your real issue with the curtains constantly being closed is that marbled leg of yours poking out the side leaving an awkward, curtained, bump in the walkway.  There are handicapped tables for a reason!  I'm sure your server would have gladly accommodated you, had you not already come in with the mindset that they were white trash and mentally retarded.  You big sweetie, you.

Sorry, I got off track.  The bacon and gorgonzola fondue is my jam.  My girlfriend went for the Wisconsin trio - also, amazing.  Are the salads simple?  Sure.  You didn't come for salads though.  With that being said, the peppercorn ranch on the house salad keeps you wanting to take another bite and the pine nuts in the caeser offer a nice balance and texture to the traditionally saltiness of a caeser dressing.  It's those small little details that can make a simple salad do the trick.

Not speaking of small, how big do we think Todd actually is?  Guy always comes back to either talking about prime rib at Maestros, or Jack In The Box.  I feel like he's the person that keeps the staff on for an extra three hours while he gorges for the winter/spring/summer/fall and picks up his greasy water glass with those ham fists, shaking it in the air and getting bits of sauce all over the clean place settings within a ten foot radius.  He's not even drinking that water!  He just keeps dabbing it on his forehead to bring momentary relief for the meat sweats.  He's probably one legit fart-gone-wrong away from blowing out the side of his gut and winding up in the ER with a qualified minority doctor.  That will of course, give him an aneurysm.  Poor Todd.  Poor sweet, sweaty Todd.

Did I mention that the service here isn't bad?  They tend to be pretty understanding with questions (was my first time, and I'm one of those inner city youth that sucked at third grade ala "El Jefe's" review) and were always pleasant from the host stand, to service, to management who knocked to check in on us.  I appreciate it anytime staff are quick to give recommendations on drinks as well.  I trust a server that can appreciate a fine cocktail.  I had the "Captain n' Coke," sans the lime.

GO, GO, GO to The Melting Pot.  It's fun for what it is.  And what it is, is an interactive dining experience meant for conversation, savory bites, and the occasional behind the curtain hand job if you're feeling frisky.  Kidding.  Cum for the food and drinks.

AVOID, AVOID, AVOID any reviews from "El Jefe."  Some people just like to complain to distract themselves from, well, themselves.  SAD.

Environment: Love sick couples and pre-teen birthdays. - 1
Appetizer: Melted Cheese = 16 bucks - 1
Main Course: I've had better meals camping. - 2
Dessert: Excellent! we had a mix of dark and white chocolates. I definitely recommend this place for dessert.+ 1

The Melting Pot does not serve gourmet food but you will pay gourmet prices. There profit margins must be pretty high here but in all honesty this is a wonderful place for a relaxing, more upscale restaurant. If you are looking for a perfect date restaurant this is it.

Lots of booths and a fireplace make the meal. They have private booths with curtains that shut out the outside world but they are super crammed. I'm claustrophobic and hated it. However, if you want to get super cozy go for it...

Reservations are strongly encouraged even when it's slow -- I think it's just how they roll. I've never had a problem getting a reservation during normal times to go. Stay away from this place on Valentine's Day. It will be packed (not romantic) and cost you a fortune. Spend that money on TRUE gourmet food.

Great wine selection with an expert to help you pick out what you want.

Why is the food bad? Well it's not bad. The cheese fondues and desserts are AMAZING. But the entrees are really pricey ($30 per person) and it's nothing special. They just bring you out the raw steak, chicken, or shrimp. Part of the reason you pay so much money for steak at higher end restaurants is the expert seasoning and grilling of the chef. 

Also, I really dislike their dinnerware: cheap, scratched plastic plates -- feels like camping gear. For that reason it's not five stars and really not worth the price. I go here because I accept the Melting Pot's faults and cannot escape cravings for their delicious cheese fondue, scrumptious desserts, and lovely atmosphere. 

Service is always amazing.

It's not really a good restaurant for kids. The can burn themselves on the fondue plate which is on the center of the table and it's really quiet in here so please only bring your kids if they are typically quiet at dinner.
We have been here for dinner in the past. First time you came for just dessert. It was a perfect way to end a perfect day. Service was fabulous, seated right away. We will be doing this again.

I've been to all other locations and decided to try this one, have always had a great experience at the others. Came to the Scottsdale location and ordered the 4 course for myself and my husband only ordered the entree section because he does not like the cheese or chocolate. When it came time for desert I asked if I could get more dippers because they say "endless dippers" and was told NO because my husband did not do the 4 course and didn't get the chocolate. So I was unable to get more dippers, which does not make sense because what I ordered came with endless dippers. It does not make sense for us to pay an extra $10 for my husband to get chocolate if he doesn't like it just so I would be able to get endless dippers like the menu says. I have NEVER been told this at the other locations I've always got what I paid for.
Always amazing. I would recommend not having eaten for a few days before coming here because it fills you up to the brim. Staff is always amazing.. wish I had this type of treatment at home!

UPDATED: I know its a bit late! I wanted to leave the original review for reference, but I had to update my review after my current experience. I have changed my review from 2 to 5 stars. As soon as I put the review up on Yelp, the next day one of the managers reached out to me and made an EXCELLENT effort to find out what ways she could talk with her staff to make sure this doesn't happen again. She asked me to give them another chance and to make our new reservations through her. I find it to be a rare occasion when someone takes the time to actually read their reviews and address the problems at hand. She assured me that my experience was not the norm and with her kind of follow-up, I'm inclined to believe her. Thank you for your efforts and I hope to make it back soon when I'm not traveling so much for work. 



ORIGINAL: Made reservations and still waited 15 minutes in the lobby awkwardly as no one was paying attention to us. This was my first time at the melting pot so I had no idea what to expect but after waiting and finally being seated we sat at the table for another 15 minutes before the waitress showed up and awkwardly/reluctantly introduced herself. Anyways, we got the new cheese fondue thing they had, and the coppa bean something rather. Not my favorite fondue or broth but the filet mignon was delicious regardless as was the ahi tuna.  All in all, I hope I will never have to go back, It just isn't my cup of tea apparently.

I went to have dinner with my family and they told us it was a one hour wait.......the wait was because they did not have servers!
What restaurant does not have servers? It does not make sense!
Terrible experience, terrible service.....keep melting your clients away! 
We are on vacations and wanted to try something new......so are now eating a the restaurant next door...many great servers available!

I've been to the melting pot in chandler, az a few times and tried out scottsdale for dessert - while the chocolate was good, our server (Joe) refused to refill our dippers even though the last time my husband and I went there, we got a refill on the dippers and once whenI went just for dessert, I got a refill on dippers as well. Basically not the best customer service, will probably stick to chandler and not go back to the scottsdale location!

I took my husband here for the first time for his birthday. He loves interactive meals like this. I knew going in this place was expensive but after spending $150 for just the two of us and comparing the price to the quality of the food I was little disappointed. I felt that the quality of the food could have been better. The fondue sauces were excellent and the cut of meat were good I think it was the veggies and fruit desserts that I was most unhappy about. Also the cocktails were just OK. I think we may have been happier at grassroots a couple places down.
So much fun!! this place is different and the customer service is amazing. If you go ask for logan as your waiter . He is so charismatic and friendly. We had such a great time!! LOGAN YOU ROCK!!!!

Automatic 20% gratuity, even increasing the credit card charge after the customer leaves.  
Is this true?
http://www.yelp.com/topic/scottsdale-automatic-20-gratuity-are-we-legally-obliged-to-pay-it-if-its-not-noted-on-the-menu

This is a great place to meet up with friends to enjoy some cocktails and fondue. In fact it is the ONLY establishment I know of that offers a full menu of nothing BUT fondue! 

The menu boasts a wide variety of options for starters, main courses and deserts.  EVERYTHING is delicious. I always choose broth over oil to cook my main course in but I've done it both ways and they are equally good. 

The Melting Pot requires at least two hours of your time AND is definitely on the pricey side so bring your Benjamin's and let loose! You are in for a really fun, interactive experience!
I have been here several times and had great service and good food each time. It is a little pricey but the experience is fun and entertaining. Highly recommended!

We've been to a couple MPs and this was not near the same experience as we have had in the past. The table was still dirty from the previous couple, the pot still had food on it from a previous cook, the veggies were not fresh and had some brown on them, my lime wedge in my drink had a rotten spot on it. It's like there was absolutely no effort put forth to make it the dining experience you go for....or that you pay for. Also our waiter was fairly new and just kept making excuses instead of trying his best. He should have maybe gotten a couple more days of training before hitting the prime time. I feel bad for my wife as she picked it for our anniversary. We will just go to a nice steakhouse next time.

I love the Melting Pot.  Its not somewhere I'd go daily or anything but once in a relationship (or once every 6 months to a year, whichever comes first) I do enjoy being taken there.  

I like going to the Melting Pot on a date as opposed to with a group because its much more intimate to feed just one person a chocolate dipped strawberry than it is to try to feed 10.  Sticks cross and that can just be uncomfortable.  

Make reservations always as it tends to get busy, as request a private table where you are separated from the rest of the restaurant by a curtain for a more intimate vibe.  No one needs to see what you're doing back there with cheese and marshmallows (not in the same course) and whatnot.  

I like the fondue for two, which includes 3 courses and a salad I believe, but come hungry because its a ton of food.  The wine selection is good and drinks are typically pretty strong.  Prices are higher than other places but for the ambiance and uniqueness of the food, and the quality of service, etc, I think its just about right for a special night out.
Great place! I took my boyfriend for his birthday and upgraded to a private booth. We enjoyed a 2 hour dinner for about $300, It was great and so worth it!!!

I went to The Melting Pot for the first time a couple weeks ago on a double date. Ambiance was wonderful and dessert fondue was absolutely amazing. The only reason I gave it 4/5 is because the expense- although I do not mind paying for good food, I do not like the attitude that sometimes go with high-class places. At one point, I felt as though I was not spoken to in an adult-like way despite us all being above legal drinking age. Perhaps it was because we look the part of 'college kids'. Overall, I'm willing to try again- it may have just been a bad night for that particular waitress.

This was my first time at the Melting Pot for dinner, I have gone before for dessert and drinks at another location. We weren't able to get a reservation until 8:30 which was ok, but then we weren't seated until close to 9:00. They were offering a special, $30 for 3 courses. The first course, the cheese was really good. Then came our entree course. Our burner was going out which wasn't an issue during the cheese. But our meats and vegetables were taking close to 10 minutes to cook, when it should take 2-3. Our waitress was aware that it was taking longer and suggested that we move, but if anyone has been there, you know it's not that simple. The dessert was next and honestly it's the only reason I would go back. Based on my first full meal experience, I will not be returning to a Melting Pot.

Oh no, I do not remember the name of our server.
The Melting Pot no longer has the charity option and although they have something similar, in my opinion it is not as good and it is more expensive.

So, I was a little disappointed.
However, the experience was still fun, and our server was very good.

These are some of the differences I noticed:
The price for the 4 course option is $55ish per person. But now if you want to make it unlimited entree it is $5 more per person. 
Then, it seems better because it now includes some cold cuts on the cheese fondue course, now you can choose any of the salads, and now you can choose oil, grill or broth for the main entree (before it was just broth) plus extra charges for flavored broths.
So, it seemed like a fair deal. Until I realized the new option did not include filet and shrimp : (

To add to my disappointment, I chose a salad that had bacon in the name, and there was no bacon in the salad, lol. It was supposed to be bacon something dressing, but for the life of me I did not taste anything bacon related. You do not do this to a bacon fan, you just don't.

Definitely a place everyone should give a whirl!  This was my first ever full meal of fondues. I have had fondue as a starter at other restaurants, but never cooked my own main course this way.  I had purchased a Living Social deal a couple months back because my bf is a big-time fondue fan and it was a good deal.  We started with the cheddar-beer cheese fondue, which the bf and I both enjoyed. It was fun to see the fondue come together before your eyes as they make it at your table. After devouring the cheese, we had ceasar salads; loved those parmesan crusted pine nuts!!  Now we move on to the main course of cooking our meats and veggies.... We chose a coq au vin broth, which is veggie broth with herbs, garlic and burgundy wine.  We had chicken, steak, pork, shrimp and assorted veggies... They will bring you food until you are stuffed or get sick of cooking! My fave meat was the pork. Not sure what they marinate in, but it is so tender and tasty!  
While it is nice to have a coursed-meal spread out over time, it can be a testament to your patience if you are hungry.  ;)  Our server was great and friendly. A manager came around and made sure we knew about the 'Free fondue for life' event going this year.  All in all, good food, good service, nice night out!
We plan to go back for just chocolate and wine next time!!

We had chad as a waiter and he TOTALLY made the experience . He was funny , knowledgable and very professional . He listened to our likes and was able to guide us in the right direction as far as choosing sauces. The food was phenomenal ! I would HIGHLY recommended melting pot Scottsdale !

Decided to use our Groupon one night and go here (celebrating my birthday and it was on a Tuesday). The service is always great and the food was good. Our Groupon was dinner for two (salad course and two entrees)...instead of the salad course we opted for a cheese course to start (I mean how can you not get a cheese course). We just choose a cheese course for one (as that was enough to share) and then we picked filet and teriyaki steak for a main dish and the cooking broth. We also each had a cocktail. Our bill would have been $100 but with the Groupon and also buying the cheese course and the drinks it came to $30 (Groupon was $25) so we spent a total of $55. Not a bad deal at all. Again, service was great as well! I know we will certainly do that again.

Very romantic experience that everyone should experience at least once in their lifetime. Interactive meal seeing as you're the chef. The meal starts with your choice of cheese fondu follows by several meat options to be cooked in oil and wine. The meal is finished with a dessert fondu. We shared the flaming turtle for dessert (which they serve on fire) and it was quite enjoyable. Plethora of choices for each course. Tables are low lit and enclosed by a curtain for ultimate privacy.

If you are not a fan of fondue, you may not enjoy this place. If you are, you have already probably been there. But, in case you haven't, you should definitely go. My wife and I have been fortunate enough to leave in three cities that have them close by. We often go and only get the Wisconsin Cheese Trio and the Peanut Butter Chocolate fondue because that will pretty much do the trick! 

But we did get a full course a couple of times and were not disappointed! The experience itself is pretty neat! The seating is as private as you want it too with a pull curtain for your booth and everything... very romantic. You get a quick course on how to dip and eat your food and the server is always nearby for anything you need. 

For a full course and a bottle of wine you can get out of there just under $100 which, I feel, is well worth it. WONDERFUL!

There are many great restaurants in the area, many of which have a unique spin or experience tied to them.  None of them match the excitement and uniqueness in my personal opinion than a visit to The Melting Pot for an evening of fondue fun for a special occasion or a happy hour!  

I wanted to do something special for my girlfriend and though I know The Melting Pot is a chain restaurant, I knew that a special evening of fondue at a slow pace in a romantic environment would be perfect, and it was.  They have several rooms with booths throughout though my favorite is the Lover's Lane, which are private rooms with only two seats side-by-side.  

We both went for the four-course meal where we both started with a cheese fondue dish (class alpine) followed by salads (both of us ordered the house salad).  We then had a "create your own" entree (pick three meats) where I chose teriyaki-marinated sirloin, premium filet mignon, and herb-crusted chicken.  My girlfriend ordered herb-crated chicken, all-natural chicken, and Atlantic salmon filet.  Finally, we wrapped up with a Yin & Yang (half dark chocolate and half white chocolate).  Every dish was delicious and filling!  Though we dipped items into the cheese and chocolate and dipped the meats into the seasoned court bouillon, our server Jason was very attentive to us and continued to give us advice and pointers.  The food, ambiance, and customer service were amazing!!  The only negative is that the price is quite hefty though the following two paragraphs will highlight a few ways to make the most bang for your buck.

The Melting Pot hosts special events regularly and a bargain-priced happy hour.  Check this link for special deals (https://www.meltingpot.com/scottsdale-az/melting-pot-events.aspx) from Wednesday Wine-Down (every Wednesday), Ladies Night Out (1st Tuesday of month), and special graduation deal where grads eat free during the month of June.  The Sip & Dip Happy Hour includes signature Sip & Dip cocktails ($5.95), select wines ($4.95/5 oz or $7.95/8 oz), $1 off any AZ craft beer, and my personal favorites:  chocolate fondue ($4.95), cheese fondue ($4.95), and salad ($2.95).  If you don't need the main dish, go for ALL-DAY happy hour in the bar area 7 days per week.

Finally, there are some great discounts available.  Check in on Yelp for a free dessert with purchase of 2 courses.  You can use the Entertainment Book for one of four different deals (25% off 4 course dinner with purchase of a 2nd on Friday or Saturday, 50% off 4 course dinner with purchase of a 2nd Sunday through Thursday, 4 course meal with endless entree for $36.95 per person, or 20-30% off a large party depending on day of week).  Next, you can purchase a $75 gift certificate at One Sweet Deal AZ (http://onesweetdealaz.com) for only $50 good through 11/1/17.  You can also write a review after visiting and receive a $25 Dip Card from your server.  Moral of the story...you don't have to pay a fortune to enjoy an amazing meal at a restaurant like The Melting Pot.

The Melting Pot is priced like a Ruth Chris or Del Frisco Steakhouses. You expect quality and higher service standards, but not the case. 
We arrived on time for our reservation and yet had to wait an additional 10 minutes even though  the restaurant was nearly empty, a family who arrived 10 minutes before their reservation told us they waited 15 minutes and then they were seated at a table right by the door. The manager on duty was seriously clueless. 
The food was good but dinner & drinks for two $205. The restaurant was understaffed and I can't say we will be back. 
We love the Melting Pot in Fort Collins! But Scottsdale your patrons cook their own food you could at least try to make their experience memorable and enjoyable.
Horrible place to bring a group. If EVERYONE including a 4 and 6 year old doesn't order off the buffet style no one can order it. Food average at best, save the money and go to Roka Akor.

Ever since I heard about the concept of the Melting Pot years ago I have been wanting to try it. My first real fondue experience (besides at my kitchen table) was last year in Washington DC at a great place called 'Bread and Chocolate' (try it next time you are in the DC area!). The second time I was lucky enough to try fondue was in NYC at an amazing French place called Artisanal Fromagerie and Bistro (another MUST TRY when you are in NYC). The third and most recent was at The Melting Pot and to be honest, I was not nearly as impressed as I thought I would be. Actually, it was kind of a buzz kill!! 

I know that The Melting Pot is a chain, but really do the servers have to so obviously say the same spiel to every table? I mean, I think I heard the same jokes and everything from every waiter. It sort of reminded me of being at a theme park for food. 

Don't get me wrong, the cheese fondue and the chocolate fondue were great but I was not impressed by the salad or the meat courses.   If I return I think I would just enjoy drinks, a little cheese fondue and of course the chocolate.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday a couple of weeks ago, and it was delicious! I've never done a fondue restaurant and wasn't sure I would like it, but I really did. We had the four-course dinner and got the fiesta cheese, the classic entree meats with mojo dipping stuff and then the chocolate turtle sauce for dessert. I would definitely recommend each of them! :) Our waiter was also very nice and accommodating, as soon as we were done with one course they'd come to clear the table and get started on the next one right away. I would for sure like to come back here again!

What is up people?  The Melting Pot is THE place to go and escape from reality.  Wifey loves to go and duck into their cozy private booths :).  Why is everyone griping about prices?  They have BOTTOMLESS fondue for $36.95 per person.  That is 4 courses.  I don't think you can get 4 courses at Chili's for that cheap.  Delicious cheese, fresh salad, cook your own food in a pot entree (Can't blame the chef for anything).  Then the best course......chocolate.  Warm, luscious, decadent, wife pleasing.  

We just ate their for our 15th anniversary (yes...she is now eligible for Sainthood) and enjoyed this meal.  I don't know if these other reviewers actually listened to their server for cooking instructions (the food is raw...you cook it) but all my items were delicious.  As for refills...looked the same as what I originally got but on a smaller plate?  Oh and we had refills, believe me we took advantage of that.

This is the place to go and spend time with your better half and relax............

How does the Visa commercial go?  Oh yeah...2 four course dinners, 4 glasses of wine, tax and tip $135.  Reward when you get home....priceless!
Excellent service by Anthony made our visit very enjoyable. Such a fun night out! Highly recommend The Melting Pot for a unique and sensational dinning experience!

You're paying a premium price to cook your own dinner?  What a racket.

Why not have the patrons wash and put away their own dishes as well?

I've been here once and never again.

I thought, it was a fun place. I enjoyed our time there and the food. The dipping dessert do-dad was bomb!! Cool place for a intimate dinner date for two. Different-fun way to inter-act and eat dinner together and spend sum quality time together. The food is good too!! I enjoyed our time there and dinner as well. I would go back again. The service was very good as well.

This intimate interactive restaurant is definitely one for special occasions. If you're going with your significant other, I suggest calling ahead and booking a private booth. This is a four-course restaurant but the two highlighted sections are the main course and desert. You get to pick your broth and meats, it also comes with vegetables. Your server will go over the cook times and the many sauces that come with it, from classic teriyaki to a spicy curry. This is the one place you want to tell the server YES to desert. Chocolate fondue....how can you go wrong there. It comes with dippers, fruits, cakes, and marshmallows covered in different flavors. Definitely a thumbs up for a special date night.

Love the melting pot! Have been a few times and it's just as great every time. It's the perfect restaurant for a romantic night out. Yes, it is pricey but it's so unique and taste great that it's worth it! Two people is about $200, but the food is delicious and we get three courses & drinks. The servers have all been amazing and it's always clean.

Went here for our 10th anniversary. We've been before so we knew what to expect. I am happy to see that the menu is more a la carte than it used to be so you can skip courses to trim the costs a bit, or go all out and do the endless fondue. We came with a Groupon and they were great about it. I wasn't in love with the swiss cheese fondue that we had for an appetizer, but hubby liked it so it was probably just me. All of the other courses were great, and the serving sizes were reasonable (aka I was stuffed). We split a single dessert between the two of us and it was a perfect end to the meal. Service was a bit on the slow side (and it wasn't crowded), but this is not the place to go if you want a quick meal, so it wasn't a huge deal. I like to have a leisurely dinner and enjoy myself.

One of our fav date night stops. We get cheese fondue, white chocolate martinis and chocolate fondue. Tonight we were there for cheese and one drink only. We sat at the bar, and The bartender was great. He made us white chocolate martinis even though they were not on the drink menu. He also gave us drinks and fondue at happy hour prices. Wow, we didn't even realize that there was happy hour pricing so that was a great surprise for us and then an extra large tip for him.

Mmmmm.  Melting Pot.   Fondue.  Dipping stuff in cheese and chocolate.  Fun!

Went here for my birthday.  Cozy, romantic atmosphere.  Knowledgeable servers and attentive staff in general.  Clean.  

If you love cheese and dipping unlimited amounts of stuff in it, then this place is for you.  

Ordered the swiss cheese dip to share with my two friends who joined me.  We made a meal out of it by also getting salads.  We're more of a budget-conscious crowd and this place can get pricey quick -  so we tried to be a little careful.  You paid for the dip, but got unlimited amounts of bread, green apples and veggies for dippin'.

Huge selection of alcohol.  Many of these drink choices were expensive, but I got the blackberry margarita ( I think that is what it was called) for $8 and it was enough to wash down my meal.  

For dessert, we got a smores type selection with chocolate/graham dip with  marshmallows, cheesecake, graham crackers, and strawberries for dipping.

All and all, we were very satisfied...and quite full because we kept getting refills on the bread dippers for the cheese.

One of my friends couldn't stop staring at the fireplace, which is one of those modern deals where the fire looks like it's moving in a circle or something.  She kept mentioning how cool it was and how she couldn't stop staring at it.  LOL.

There are two main reasons why this place doesn't get five stars (but four is still pretty damn good).  One being price.  The other being overall food selection.  The menu itself wasn't very diverse, or at least nowhere near as diverse as the alcohol selection.  There were a lot of shellfish type items and some of us are allergic to that stuff.  I was tempted to get some steak dippers, but the price would have really skyrocketed there for us.  

The Melting Pot is perfect for special occasions or a fancy meal from that hot date.  Their hours are limited, so it's easier to make reservations online.  You could easily lose track of time there and hang out for hours getting refills on dippers and drinks.  Good times!

reserved a private booth and didnt get it even though it was very slow 
i just didnt care for the place at all 
the waitress was very nice dessert was the best i would go for dessert but thats about it
Other than the cockroach that ran across the top of our table during the meal and the stale bread that was hard enough to cut the top of our mouths our meal was nice.

My boyfriend and I came for our anniversary and we really enjoyed the food and the service was great!   We're looking forward to our chocolate fondue. We'll definitely be coming back.  The private booth added a nice touch.

The Melting Pot probably deserves 3.5 stars, but I'm hoping my next visit will bump it up to 4. 

It is definitely hard not to like this place. Matt T. said it well that this is a "dining experience". I've had meals here that have taken hours, but it's also quite nice to stop in for just cheese and chocolate. (They have a Mon.-Fri. happy hour here where you can get cheese and chocolate courses for $5 each...but you have to sit at the bar.)

I am the person who is obsessed with cheese and I think almost everything tastes better with cheese somewhere in the mix, so I always look forward to the cheese course.. I am proud to say that one thing I can actually make at home is my own cheese fondue. It's not cheap to eat at The Melting Pot, but it's not cheap to make on your own either. The one difference is that I think mine tastes slightly better (maybe I'm just partial). The flavor is interesting, but always seems to be missing something. Worth $16? Probably, but certainly doesn't blow me away.

The dessert is a bit more impressive. A variety of sweets dipped in rich chocolate is always delicious. The Melting Pot provides strawberries, brownies, banana, marshmallow, cheesecake, pound cake, and Rice Krispies Treats to dip into your choice of chocolate. It is heavenly! However, I wish they also offered pineapple. 

Eating the full four course meal here is definitely pricey, but I like that you can cut corners and find ways to make it cheaper. The service is usually quite good, but recently I found that mine was just okay. The managers often make their way around to check on tables which is nice. The atmosphere is most definitely dark and romantic. My boyfriend and I were once given a private booth (with a drawn curtain) which was really nice, but also kind of weird. Our server had to knock before she opened the curtain every time....what are they suggesting goes on in those booths? Apparently it's The Melting Pot/Peep Show. 

I always get excited when making a reservation to visit, but I usually leave feeling stuffed, but slightly underwhelmed.

You can't go wrong - or leave completely stuffed - at the Melting Pot.

I was excited for the Living Social deal a couple months ago for 3 courses (cheese, salad, endless entree) plus a champagne toast for a fraction of the cost. This particular location has a ton of "Lover's Lane" seating - a tiny table for 2 with the option to close curtains for privacy. 

I've never had even remotely average service - it's always been top-notch. The food is obviously incredible as well. I love how dinner takes 2 hours here because 4 courses sure is a lot of food. 

Great date spot!

Gross!! This place is really bad. We had moldy bread served to us and we complained and they brought "new" bread which also had mold on it. We complained again and they comped our meal  and water and away we went. We didn't even get to the meats and seafood. I'm not sure what is going on here but this place just looked tired and worn out. The vegetables were old and tasted bad. Nothing seemed fresh. I felt a little sick after leaving here. I will never go here again. It's just a dirty place with bad food and that's just wrong. If you want to serve the public at least serve fresh food.

This place is amazing. It is a little pricy, so it isn't an every week kind of place. But for special occasions, it is great. We celebrated my birthday with wine, green chile cheese fondue, lobster, steak and classic chocolate peanut butter. At first it didn't seem like a lot of food, but we left stuffed. It is an experience and fun to watch your food cook at your table.

My girlfriend and I just ate here for our one year anniversary. We got a private booth that has a privacy curtain so our table is completely secluded from the restaurant. Very romantic. You have a choice of up to 4 courses and we chose 3. The first is a cheese fondue with about 6 different options of cheese combinations. You can dip several breads and veggies. The second is salad, which we skipped. The third is entree and there are many delicious meat and seafood options with several fondue broth options. Desert was the last and so damn good! Many options from cheese cake to Oreo covered marshmallows.

If you haven't had a chance to eat here I definitely recommend it! Very friendly and knowledgable staff. Give it a shot!

I do believe that the customer is always right. I don't abuse that privilege. However, if I take time out of my day to personally report discrepancy in my billing, I believe the management should be considerate and do what he can to make sure that he earns my repeat business by offering an apology, and doing whatever is within his power to correct any mistakes or promise to (and follow through with) report(ing) back to me when he uncovers the cause of said discrepancy. None of this took place, of course. The management did not apologize, did not follow through, and offered no means of reconciliation when one of his staff allegedly applied her own (additional) tip to our bill. Our server even went so far as to suggest how much we should tip her, prior to our credit card signature, which is very unprofessional since a tip is a customer's option not a server's entitlement. We will not be returning to this business. Pay in cash if you do plan a visit to this location.

The service and food was wonderful with one exception.  When we walked in on this last Sunday night and stated that we had a reservation, our hostess was about to seat us when another couple walked in and she dropped us to assist them and brought them to the dining room.  Then she tried to place us in a private booth with curtains.  So Im not sure if she thought my friend and I were a couple.  She made it apparent who she thought deserved priority without explanation.  At that point my friend, another male told her we needed to be seated elsewhere and it was not "date night"  and she found us a different area.  Bad first impression.  Once upon being seated however, everything was as smooth as could be, drinks were great, food was great and service was wonderful.  I'm glad the waitress over came the bad first impression the hostess created when we first got there.

Food is delicious but WAY overpriced.  Don't get me wrong, I would still recommend it for a special but very rare occasion.

The highlight of the evening was the dessert (flaming turtle with dark chocolate)- it was like an orgasm for your tongue.  We'll probably go back for a romantic after-dinner dessert sometime, or just stick to their happy hour cheese and chocolate special.  That's pretty much the only way to get out for under $100.   But I will say, the experience is worth the occasional splurge.

I took off one star for price, and another because they keep their happy hour under wraps.  It's not advertised, servers and host don't mention it, and you have to ask to be seated at the bar in order to get it.  But if you walk in and tell them that's what you're after, it's a much better deal.  ($5 per person cheese $5 per person dessert).  Very intimate.  Nice way to spend an evening.  Provided your pockets are lined with $100 bills of course.

My girlfriend and I went to The Melting Pot this past Saturday night and the experience was HORRIBLE.  It was 9:30 when we showed up and when we walked in we were greeted with a rude hostess.  She did not greet us but instead asked "What can I do for you?" with attitude.  Well, it's a restaurant, so I guess I was there to get my haircut!  When I responded a table for 2 she asked, again with attitude, if I had a reservation.  The restaurant was not even half full.  I said no, she then asked "well are you having a full course meal?" and I responded "Just dessert".  After waiting a about 3 minutes, we were finally sat.

The horrible experience did not end there.  It took TEN minutes before our waitress even came to our table.  They  had a full waitstaff that just kept walking by our table staring at us.  When our waitress finally did come, she was also rude and offered no pleasantries.  We order the Original for 2 and our drinks.  Everything was then served together.  I must say the chocolate fondue was delicious.  However, our waitress NEVER came back to check on us or refill our drinks or how our drinks and food were (For the record, the Cafe Mocha was ice cold).  And with heavy food like that, water is a must!  When we were done, she finally came over after I flagged her down, then asked if we wanted refills.  I said yes and the check.  Once I paid, she brought back my card and just left the checkbook on the table.  No "Thank you have a nice evening, Thank your for coming in", nothing.  

We were very excited about having a fantastic dessert but the rude staff there ruined the entire experience.  We will not be going back to the Scottsdale location.

Not really what i expected it to be.. The only thing both me nd my fiancée enjoyed was the appetizer and the dezzert.. The entree was basically a boiled entree witch u gotta do yourself.. Totally not worth 40 bucks a plate or so called "entree"
Im rating 2 stars cause of the dezzert..

This has to be one of the most overpriced restaurants I've ever been to.  Food was just OK, not great.  Bill worked out to be about $70/person including one beer each. There are too many other good places to eat for me to ever consider going back.

Went here tonight for my bf's birthday dinner. Made reservations, but had to wait a good 5 minutes in the lobby to be seated. Totally fine.
Was seated....waited for menus...finally our waitress shows up and awkwardly announces that a second server would be shadowing her all night. Cool. At first we figured she was training her shadow, but we quickly realized it was her shadow who was observing her, as a new hire. Also, totally fine.

I really hate to say this and it takes a lot for me to complain about service, but it was pretty horrendous. There was not once a crack of a smile from our waitress, and her questions and instructions were super short, unfriendly, and awkward, for lack of a better word.  I think she must have been nervous, to be being shadowed by someone obviously observing her every move and word. I would be, too! But geez - there was very little effort on her part.

When you are paying this much for a dinner, you really expect top notch service, so this was disappointing for sure.  

Love the food (duh), atmosphere, and idea of the place. We had a great time, and will try again, hoping for some better service next time.

First time to a Fondue Restaurant definitely a unique experience. Definitely more of a date place than family outing. The staff was very helpful guiding my friend and I on what to order. Definitely will go again but probably with a date not to hang out with a friend from out of town.

Came here on Saturday night for the first time and WOW! We had a private booth which I  definitely recommend! For the appetizer we had the Fiesta fondue followed by a house salad and the main entree consisted of Teriyaki-marinated sirloin, filet mignon, chicken breast, shrimp and spinach ravioli. For dessert we had the white chocolate creme brulee and I was blown away by how delicious everything was! What made it even better was our server Hayden, he was very personable and made the dining experience very fun!

I've been here a few times. A couple of times with the husband to enjoy a Groupon and a special menu option. And twice for ladies night with the co-workers since they do a special ladies night menu the first Tuesday of every month - which has a good price for all you get!

We almost always call ahead and make reservations - on ladies night, a reservation is a MUST since it fills up quickly.  The staff is always really friendly and they are more than happy to walk you through the process if you are new here.  The drinks are strong and the food comes in stages so you can really make this an great date night.  

I'd be torn to choose between the cheese appetizer and the chocolate dessert for my favorite part of the meal, but since I'm more of a sweet than salty fan, I'll go with the dessert.  They always have special check-in offers and from time to time they offer Groupons, as well.  If you sign up online for their mailing list, you'll get some decent offers there, too!

Overall: A
A great spot for a date night experience, ladies night out, or special dinner for a loved one! Be sure to seek out specials since it can get a touch pricey.

Okay, so I should have had a better idea of what to expect, but I suppose my expectations were too high. I started out with a Cesare salad, which was just an average salad; nothing really special about it. I then got my entree, which consisted of 5 shrimp,  5 duck breast medallions,  5 fillet mignon medalions, and a few pieces of potato, broccoli,  and mushroom. It was a TINY dinner! Like, I've seen kids meals that were bigger than what I received for what would have been $40 if I hadn't had a groupon. Still though, I wouldn't even pay half price again for what I received for my meal. And I didn't even think that my meal was extraordinary! If it had been amazing, then I could see the reasoning for their outrageous prices,  but it's just not worth paying those prices just to have your own cooking pot at your table. The only reason that I'm giving them 2 stars is because the staff were all really nice and attentive.

I had never been to The Melting Pot and was really looking forward to it with a couple of friends. 
We had a 6:30PM reservation and felt rushed the entire time by our server. 
We had just sat down at our table and were deciding on drinks. Our server actually said, "have a cheese selected by the time I come back". This pissed me off immediately. First, I have never been there and didn't even know what he was talking about and second, I was still deciding on what I wanted to drink. I asked him "what happens if I don't have a cheese selected?"  His reply was "then I give you more time" for which I responded with "that's what I thought" in the most condescending attitude I could. Don't piss me off you high school punk. 
His attitude became better after that, but then he tried to talk us out of ordering the bourguignonne which is the canola oil cooking style. Dude, that's what we want okay!?  I then overheard our server tell another table that the bourguignonne was his favorite cooking style. WTF?
I had the French Quarter selection which was chicken, beef, shrimp and sausage all seasoned in Cajun spices. It was very good. 
Out server kept coming by to check on this and would tell is that "we needed to have all out skewers in the pit at once or else this would take all night." We just ignored him and did what we pleased. 
Then about half was through our server told us that we needed to select a chocolate. I said "we aren't even half way done here."  In the end we selected the s'mores chocolate and it was very good. 
All in all, food was good but it was not an enjoyable experience. 
I guess our server was in a rush to get out of there? Maybe that's just how The Melting Pot operates? 
Either way, glad I tried it, but I wouldn't go back. I was really turned off by the rushed service.

Okay, so now that I've experienced it myself, I have no idea what the hype is over this weird cook-it-yourself restaurant. I was excited to go and have my anniversary dinner at the location in Scottsdale even tho my husband wanted us to go to Donovan's (hindsight is 20/20 people!) I placed our reservation the day before and requested a private booth, although I was told that they could not promise me one, whatever, I get it, no problem. We get there and our first impression is even before we enter the restaurant...it smells like sewer outside, who wants to smell that just before eating an EXPENSIVE dinner? Red flag #1...I should have turned around right then. As we are being seated, I notice that there are at least 4 available private booths even though I was told by the manager that we would have to wait at least an hour and a half for one...red flag #2 (I do not like being lied to!). We sit at the table waiting for our waitress to come over which took at least 10 minutes, and another 10 just to get our water. We then order the four course meals and I still think it's a novel idea, cooking my own food...ha! The appetizer cheese seriously took at least another 10 to 15 minutes to get to our table and to be honest, it wasn't good...I've had better Artichoke dip at Oregano's...Red flag #3. Then our salads come out, and my initial thoughts are: these look like the salads from Bill Johnson's Big Apple...NOT GOOD! I then find a romaine heart in my salad, so clearly the expediter didn't pay attention when sending out the food. Another red flag...we're up to 4 now...too many for anything good to happen now...so we finish our appetizer and cheese and after at least 15 minutes of the romaine heart sitting on display on top of my plate so she can see it, another random waitress comes to pick up our plates and the fondue pot without saying a word to us...rude! We then have to wait ANOTHER 20 minutes for our waitress to even walk by our table. Meanwhile the table across from us who has 2 more people than us and who was seated after us is already served their entrées. I'm upset at this point. Then our waitress casually walks by and says "wow, they've already cleaned it off, they're fast....NO YOU'RE JUST SLOW!!! I ask her for a refill of our waters which she says she'll get asap....we waited at least another 10 minutes for her to come by with a pitcher of water...what is she doing for so long?! 20 minutes go by, my husband and I start joking about how we are glad we ate some Jack-in-the-box tacos before coming because we would be starving again if we hadn't since the food is taking FOREVER! And for what? THEY DON'T EVEN COOK THE FOOD FOR YOU, so what's taking so long???!!!!!! I immediately regret my decision of wanting a fun whimsical dinner when the raw meat comes to our table...it's no longer fun, it's disgusting. The cooking liquid we chose, Mojo, is gross...should have gone with the Veggie broth, or better yet, just not eaten here! The waitress told me when we ordered that she could make the broth as garlicky or not garlicky as I wanted, however as she's putting the stuff in the cooking liquid, she just dumps in the cilantro and garlic WITHOUT ASKING IF I WANT MORE OR LESS...UMMM...EXCUSE ME BUT DIDN'T WE GO OVER THIS WITH YOU BEFORE?! I guess I can't be too hard on her, we did have that conversation like an hour ago...So after cooking our own food, we neatly stack all of our plates up and patiently wait another 10 minutes for her to come get them...mind you, she never came by once to ask how we were doing and if we needed anything. We order dessert and yet again, I have to ask for more water because she never seems to notice that our glasses are empty. This time she came to refill our water in a timely manner...however, the dessert (some melted chocolate and pre-cut NOT tasty things to dip in it) took 15 minutes to get to our table and we had to wait another 10 for it to get warm. The little brownie, of which there is only 1 on a serving plate for 2 people, and the other thing...which I think was a chocolate chip cookie or something...we're clearly store bought and the brownie at least was gross (I didn't try the other one...it looked like bad banana bread but didn't smell like anything...), not to mention the strawberries, they clearly had been washed, cut and left in water because they looked pale, we're soft and nearly flavorless...they should know not to leave strawberries in water or they break down immediately...very disappointing seriously, I can do all of this myself, why did I pay over $100 for this poor service and cooked the freaking food myself?! Lesson learned! We will never be back and I do NOT recommend going for anything other than dessert and if you choose to do that, bring your own stuff to dip in it, because they definitely don't give you enough! Overall, a totally disappointing anniversary dinner! We will never be back!

Went here for a date night with my boyfriend and it was definitely a success. We were greeted promptly and got a seat right away (even though we did make reservations). Our server was amazing. I, unfortunately, forgot her name. She was very knowledgeable and since I was new there she definitely helped me out on what the Melting Pot was all about. The food and drinks came out very promptly and she always had my drinks refilled before it even ran out. She always seem to care about us and if we were unhappy with anything to let her know and she will fix it right away. 
The food was amazingly delicious. This place definitely is great for a cute date night. :)

Never paid full price before always had some sort of deal. The deals always seemed worth while, full price seems a lot steep for what you get. Yes its a beautiful atmosphere and the staff is nice or nice to a point. 
I love cheese but maybe i don't like cheese fondue I was not thrilled with the taste of the basic chedder version. 
On the other hand the toffee chocolate dessert fondue was exquisite I want to drown in a vat of it.

Main course was right on good quality meats and a good variety on the special I ordered.

The spinach salad was wonderful and delicious but small for the price. 

I would eat the salad and the desert again and skip the rest.

I really did have a hard time decided how many stars to give this place. There was some ups and downs with the whole experience. I'll write this review and you decide how many stars it should have...

Decor: when walking into the restaurant, I will say it looks stunning. The ambiance is very relaxing, romantic. The bar is right next to the entrance, and there's a nice fireplace not far away. It was very welcoming, and I felt like this was going to be an intimate experience.

Food: ok, so this is where the review gets a little muddled. We all got three courses, and the first was the cheese fondue. We decided to get cheddar, and spinach artichoke. When the began making it, the cheese looked like something you'd buy from the store. Kraft shredded cheese to be exact. It had that white hue to it, and looked preserved/processed. The taste wasn't the most pleasant either. Tasted like cheap beer mixed with cheap cheese. For $9 a person, I would've liked something more. It came with stale tasting bread, and some apples.

Then some of us got salads, which totally improved the mood. I got the Cesar salad, which was nice. It had parmesan coated pine nuts, tasted delicious. So, that's a huge plus. 

Main course was interesting. We got the complimentary court bouillon cooking method. There are three others, which cost around $6 a person more, so that wasn't happening since we had a party of 8. It tasted and smelled like those cubed bouillon with some herbs thrown in. The entrees did have a decent portion size, but $20 bucks a plate was pretty steep. 

Dessert was amazing! We got two different chocolates, and they were delicious. It came with strawberries, pound cake, rice crispy treats, marshmallows, the works. That was a nice way to finish the meal.

Service: so, this was hard. The waitress tried hard, but she also was non-existent at times. I had to go find her during the meal so we could get our main courses, and water fills. The restaurant wasn't packed by any means. Which left a sour note in our mouths.

Overall: For the price paid, I feel like we should've received a lot more. Get better cheeses, something that doesn't taste fake. Lower the prices so it's more affordable for middle class patrons. For 8 people the bill was around $300 dollars, which is rough when there was only water, and 2 adult beverages added. So, I'd bring a nice amount of cash or money in the bank before coming.

Went here for my birthday in the hopes of reliving some great fondue experiences I had in Switzerland. Since I'm a vegetarian and also wanted "cheese as a meal" for my birthday,  my friend and I decided to order two cheese fondues and skip the "meals". The cheese selections were great but the dippers were left to desired. The bread was overall a bit stale and crusty. The pretzel bread was good though. The "veggies" really left a lot to be desired. A few broccoli, carrots, celery and tomatoes. Really?? A tomato?  Not what I normally associate with fondue.  The waiter (who was awesome by the way!) was kind enough to scrounge up some mushrooms for our next round but it really seems like that should be a staple already. 

We decided to splurge for a dessert round of chocolate fondue. The chocolate was nice but it felt like it could have been thicker. The sweet treats that came with for dipping were nice but I would have preferred more fruit. 

Overall I'd say while the actual cheese fondue was good, the items to dip in it left to be desired. I do hope in the future they consider adding more fruits and veggies to the mix, until then I may just invest in a fondue pot of my own.

Melting Pot was the perfect girl's night out! We had a great experience. Our survey, Hayden, was great at explaining his recommendations for each course and continually checking to ensure we were enjoying ourselves and seeing how else he could assist. The food was delicious and we left so happy and content with our amazing meal.

I hate to be this person but I am still so disappointed about my dinner from last night. It was my boyfriends birthday yesterday and I made dinner reservations for 7:30pm and mentioned that it was my boyfriends birthday so that we could do the whole four courses, since my boyfriend had never been to The Melting Pot. I have always had pleasant experiences at The Melting Pot in northern California but I feel as though at the Scottdale location off of Hayden, they did not care about creating a intimate/exciting experience for their guests.
