We walked in and the host and I am guessing it was the manager for that night, were at the stand. They both looked annoyed and questioned if they could help up, no hello greeting, as if they thought we were going to walk in without a reservation. We are on the younger side, 22 and 26 and I felt extremely judged by the woman and man from the beginning as if we didn't belong. We were escorted to our table and it was the cutest booth with a curtain to hide us (even though our server kept leaving it open). I loved that, but unfortunately they sat us right next to the kitchen door and we could hear the kitchen staff yelling the entire time (seriously yelling). I felt annoyed because all the other booths around us were empty, stayed empty the entire time we were there and when we left around 9:45pm they were still empty. I am not sure why they would sit us so close to the kitchen when there were plenty of open tables. 

I cannot remember our waiters name but he mentioned that he had been working at The Melting Pot for three years, was one of the bartenders, and a manager as well. I have been a server for 5 years myself and I have experience in fine dining restaurants and I sadly have to say our waiter was the reason for my two star review and made it hard for me to give him a fair tip. He had no energy, talked monotoned, and made things feel very awkward. I felt disappointed because I am aware of how you should serve a guest, especially when it is one of the guests first times at the restaurant or their birthday/special occasion. 

The food was GREAT. My boyfriend and I enjoyed ourselves because we refused to allow bad service to ruin the night. I had higher expectations because our server is one of the managers, which might be my fault but the service was terrible and I really don't want this to happen to anyone else!

Had a LivingSocial that I bought months ago & finally went on Saturday for dinner, the day before it expired. Had a reservation at 8:15 PM, arrived around 8PM and they seated us right away. Our waitress, Ali, was really good and said she had only been working there 2 months. The LivingSocial I got was only $40 and included 2 salads, cheese fondue, 2 entrees, and our waitress included chocolate for us. Amazing deal IMO. We also got a bottle of wine which was $29 & upgraded the cooking style to the Coq Au Vin - which was great, worth the extra $6. Now for my review of the food: 
*Salad - got the Caesar & House salad, both were good, I recommend putting the Garlic & Wine Seasoning on it
*Cheese Fondue - we got the Spinach Artichoke ; it was amazing! I love how fresh it is, you actually watch them put every ingredient into the pot. 
*Individual Entrée Main Course - we got to pick 2 so we got the Filet Mignon & the All Natural Breast of Chicken. The steak was really good & both of our favorites. The chicken was okay, it didn't have much flavor and was a little bland, I kept having to dip it in the different sauces that are given to you. Next time, I would get something besides the chicken. Also, this comes with a bowl of vegetables -- potatoes, broccoli, and mushrooms. I paired them with the green goddess and bleu cheese sauces. YUM!
*Chocolate course - unfortunately I cannot review this because we got it to-go and then left it at the table :( bummer!

Anyways, it was a great meal, something different then a typical date night somewhere else. I would probably be more likely to come back with a LivingSocial or Groupon deal just because it isn't cheap.

The melting pot went above and beyond to make our experience amazing! I received a call from the manager and was told that our waitress had injured her arm that same night so she was in pain. (Completely understandable) he welcomed us back and we went a couple of nights after valentines day. We got a private booth and had a great night. 
Thank you Melting Pot!

Fun to do the fondue with family, friends or just with your love one. Beautiful romantic setting especially if you just go with your love one and get the private cozy room.

The quality of meat selections were decent, I wish they provide more vegetables. The cheese that they use seems regular cheese, nothing fancy.

The dessert fondue it was OK, I wish they use more healthier sweets to deep in the dark chocolate.

Service was good and the manager event came to our table to check on us couple times, that was nice.

The pricing was a bit to high, but overall it was good but not great!

Yes, this place can be a bit pricey, however if you catch them at happy hour or on "girls night out" it can be very affordable. The atmosphere and the "specialness" of the melting pot is unbeatable. I have been there for intimate occasions, and family birthdays. Food is wonder, especially the cheese! The menu has changed a bit over the years, and there are some oldies I would love to see return (the mushroom salad), but there is nothing that beats this place for any special occasion

The complaints and bad reviews left for this place are a bit over the top. It's really not that expensive for all of the food and service you receive. I saw someone say it's $70 per person per meal, umm.. that's depending on what you choose. A four course meal for me was around $45 and for my boyfriend who chose lobster, it was $54 or something for his four course meal. I was nervous to come here for my birthday and anniversary celebration after reading so many negative reviews but I'm glad I came in anyways. 

I called and scheduled a dinner for two on a Sunday night, requesting one of the private booths with curtains. The ONLY problem all night (which is not really a problem at all because we were still sat and only had to wait maybe 3 minutes - no biggie!) was that my reservation was not made or written down. I double checked to make sure I called the right restaurant and I did, the only thing we missed out on was a rose petal set up (for $15, I'd rather save the money) that I thought was obligatory to get the private booth I wanted. The host / manager seemed a little annoyed when I told her I called the right restaurant, but I may have been coming off wrong, she may have been having a bad night, etc. She came back to check on us later which I appreciated. 

FOOD was amazing! Salad is plain but delicious, my boyfriend loved whatever nuts they added to the Caesar. We had the regular land meat entree and the seafood one with lobster, shrimp, ravioli, etc. and shared them. They were amazing and the veggies that come on the side are so yummy!! Dessert is great too, next time I'll let my boyfriend choose because I chose the basic one and eat peanut butter daily so I didn't need more, but I thought I did! 

Our server was wonderful, he did a great job and checked on us consistently. Timing was always good, we were never waiting nor rushed. Dinner was absolutely amazing, my boyfriends first time and he fell in love too. We can't wait to come back!! 

The prices aren't that bad! Pay attention to where you are dining! If you want the extra special spot, ask for or call to reserve one of the booths with a curtain for two. Don't listen to the people who have left reviews who don't know how to pay attention to what they're doing. I serve at a restaurant and can tell when people are mad their tab comes out high, *pay attention.* 

Thank you, Melting Pot!! We will be back :-)

For the price you're better off buying a fondue pot and doing this at home... plus it can be much more romantic.  I'm never a big fan of chains, and although this one manages to gain points from the atmosphere standpoint, the prices just don't justify food that any novice can make.  If money is no object and you want someone to serve you, there isn't anything "bad" about Melting Pot.

I was really excited to come here. When I went to Switzerland, I absolutely died over the yummy cheese fondue I got to have so I was expecting great things from this famous Melting Pot. However, I'm still really undecided about this place. I thought the food was pretty good. I felt it was overpriced, but hey, it's fondue. What should I expect? The alpine was a pretty good fondue, I will say that. The meat was also quite wonderful. However, the service really kicked me. 

First of all, we got to out reservation on time, but were seated nearly 20 minutes after our arrival. They didn't seem to care about us or the fact that we were waiting. That started us off on the wrong foot.
We just had a really strange waitress that had a dry and sarcastic humor. While I am usually fine and used to this, going on a date out to dinner? She really brought down the mood. It was really awkward... She was, however, attentive, so I do give her that. Just compared to the other servers I was witnessing, I felt like we were getting short changed. We weren't really given in-depth explanations like the table next to us. And there's nothing I dislike more than someone who says they just like everything..

Another thing I have to say is that with the living social deal they offer, you just get salad and then the meat/cooking style. We ended up walking out with about a $50 bill on top of it for the cheese fondue (for 2) and one drink. They also include a 20% gratuity. We felt like after the price of the deal and what we paid on top of that, we could have done the endless fondue and gotten way more food for almost the same price. That really irked me... It's smart because it gets you there and you're tempted to spend, spend, spend, but I won't be doing that again.

Anyways, I may go back in the future and try The Melting Pot again, but I don't believe it will be at this location that I do.
They invited me back. And THe food was fantastic. As well as our server was amazing. Will will try to forget about my previous encounter here and will continue to return.

I'm leaving a negative review but I'm not mad at you Melting Pot.  The service was really professional and nice.

But it was a bit ridiculous. Despite having reservations and the place being half full, it took over 10 minutes to be seated?  Not fun when you have a 10 yr old and a 6 yr old in tow.  They were very well behaved but it's a lot better when we get settled, ya know?

so, on to the food.  It was my daughter's birthday and she loves all things cheese related, so we decided, fondue! perfect.

The classic cheddar fondue had some bad light beer and a lot of garlic.  not sure that was fresh garlic but regardless, it was raw and the fondue pot did not cook it.  The whole cheese fondue had a terribly astringent taste to it as a result.  

My daughter wouldn't even eat it.  Which is crazy if you know her.  She'll eat camembert, gorgonzola, the stinkiest french cheese you can imagine.  I found it hard to eat as well.

I mean, cmon man, how to you mess up melted cheese!!??  Is there a chef who actually tastes the food on occasion or do you just leave it to the servers?  My daughter said:  "So we're actually paying them and we have to cook our own food?"  Well, good point, but that is the idea with fondue I guess.

one extra star for the chocolate fondue that they comped for her birthday, that was very cool.  Still the bill was serious.  Not sure I really get the food quality/portion to value ratio.

Anyway, I think that was a one and done thing for us.

This place is right up my ally. It has amazing food, great service, private dining areas for special and romantic occasions, and offers a very interactive experience. We got the 4 course meal for our anniversary, ended up costing me $100 but it was worth the experience and of course...anything for my wife right?! First was our salads, then we got our appetizer which was sharp cheddar cheese fondue dipped with vegetables, potatoes, and a few other delicous foods. Next was our entrée and it came with this amazing fondue broth that our meat or shrimp gets cooked in. We had a bunch of sauces to dip our meat in too...amazing!!! Lastly but definitely not least, was desert. We got the smores fondue and it was amazing. Probably one of the best deserts I've had in a long time. At first glance, I didn't think it was much food, but it's alot and fills you up no question. I would definitely come here again.

Came here with a friend to use my Groupon. It was our first time and we had wanted to try this place for a while. The hostess seated me in one of their curtained booths and my friend arrived later. I kinda liked it, gave us some privacy and it was a different experience. The hot plate was heating the pot as we waited for our cheddar cheese fondue, which we substituted vegetable broth instead of the beer ingredient. Our server made the fondue in front of us, which was cool to see. It comes with yummy bread, Granny Smith apples, carrots, broccoli, and cauliflower. I expected a creamier consistency, but it was still good. We also ordered their house salad, which was fine. I realize I don't care for cheddar cheese on my salad. It took a while for our salads to come out, which was kinda weird. We were pretty full from the fondue so it wasn't a big deal. It took some time for our server to bring out the dessert menu, and we went with the pure dark chocolate. Delicious!! Best part of our meal. I liked the fruits the best (bananas, pineapples and strawberries). We didn't want marshmallow treats but the communication wasn't conveyed clearly and we still got them. I just didn't want them to waste them since we weren't gonna eat them, but oh well. Overall, a good experience and probably just a one time thing, but maybe I'll be back and try their good earth vegetarian. Staff was plenty nice and made sure we were okay throughout our meal.

Umm.. I might be biased a bit because I actually worked here while at ASU. So I figured I'd give you a few tips for anyone that hasn't been here before.

- Not a place to impress a first date. Listen, you'll be here for at least an hour and a half (for 2 people), hour is you really rush. With LOTS of downtime that could lead to really, really awkward conversation. Go on a first date somewhere else and use this place to "seal the deal" guys, you're welcome. 

- Don't be cheap. If you can't afford to go all out, just save up and come back another time. Get the full 4 courses and a good bottle of wine. If you don't know anything about wine, don't be afraid to ask your waiter. Tell them you want to try something first before buying the bottle and they'll bring you sample. Tell them if you only want to under X amount of dollars, too. Don't be afraid to say that you are looking for something under $35, there were plenty of wines that are GOOD for under that price at the Pot. And there are VERY good wines under $50, so know what you want to spend if you don't have an idea already.

- Make reservations. I probably should have put this first, oh well. 

- If it's a special occasion, let them know when you make the reservation. Ask for a private booth if you really want privacy during your meal. But please, don't have sex or get too frisky while in that booth. Yes, it does happen and it makes it kind of awkward for the server. Save it for later, and if you can't help yourself, ask the server to hold up the meal and go back to your car.

- And finally, tip your server well. This is not your typical serving job and there is a lot going on with your meal. Between them cooking it, making sure your safe (guess what? hot oil can be dangerous!) and doing their best to make it special for you - it's only polite. 

I think that's it. enjoy it.

My husband and I came here for our one year wedding anniversary. We have been here several times before and I love it. The food is so good and the dessert is the best part. Our server was very friendly, helpful, and gave us everything we needed. We had a great night. I will keep coming back to this place.

It's not that I wouldn't tell people to go here but this is what I would tell you. 1. Do not ever go here with a pregnant woman. We went here for our anniversary and I am 6 months pregnant. They sat us first in a tiny little booth, my belly was already touching the table and I began to get claustrophobic. I have never seen a booth so small in my life. It is a total design error. Private booths yes, not tiny private booths in a cubby in the wall--so uncomfortable. We asked to be moved, which I really felt for a place where we were spending that much money should have probably noticed that I was pregnant and found me the best most comfortable seat in the house--instead they found us a table with torturously hard chairs. Then they told me the big surprise that this is a 2 hour dining experience--a 6 month pregnant woman cannot sit in hard chairs for two hours--again someone should have noticed this and offered a better seating. I tried to brave it, in between the painfully slow out lay of tiny courses--again not fit for a starving pregnant woman--for about 2 hours, finally after several trips to the bathroom just to get the feeling back in my legs my husband had to ask to be moved again to an obviously better spot next to us--an open, normal sized booth with a cushy seat. I liked our waiter, very friendly, and the chocolate fondue at the end of the endless fondue was to die for. I'd go back and specify that I want a normal sized booth and probably just get the cheese fondue and chocolate. The other entrees were okay, but bring me out my food not in a trickle feed. By the end we had spent 3 hours there, had to move twice and I was just exhausted by the end and we paid over $130 for the whole thing. I've been to nicer restaurants and paid as much for more caring service perhaps and amazing food. It was alright, but again there's just a lot to know about the melting pot before you decide to spend three hours there. If you're looking for a romantic time with just some light eating and conversation then that's what this place has to offer, but men before you bring your girl there make sure to request a normal booth, and maybe think about ordering a la carte if you don't want to wait hours for your 4-course meal to be done.

Um, excuse me, I didn't have such a great experience. To start off, my table was very dirty. I ordered what I thought was some good cheese, but it was awful. They give you the smallest containers with bad tasting fruits and vegetables that you could get at your local grocery store for a few cents. The 5 chips they give you are stale and gross. The bread is ok, but they only give you 4 little pieces of it. The portion sizes are tiny, terrible, and tragic. Avoid this place at all costs.

Went here a few weeks ago. As others have said, you're paying a lot for a gimmick, and the novelty wears off pretty quickly...particularly after you realize you've paid over $100 for you and your date to cook your own food (after a lengthy trial and error process).  The initial cheese fondue was delicious, as was the salad course. And you can't go wrong with chocolate fondue for dessert. But I could've stopped there.  

The entree is where things kind of go off the rails.  You're cooking your own meat (a few pieces each of steak, pork, chicken, shrimp, or lobster) and veggies (broccoli, potatoes, mushrooms), and you don't quite get the perfect timing until well into the meal. The meat itself can be a little bland--you're basically just deep frying it. And while a long, slow meal with your date is romantic, it does get a little tedious to cook each individual bite. Yes, we knew what we were getting into when we went there--a place that's a little unique, but again, that wears off pretty quick.

That said, there's nothing the staff could've done better. They were attentive and helpful, and the small booth (with curtains) was an intimate way to dine out. Still I don't think I'll be back, and if I do, I'll probably skip the entree and just stick with the other elements of the four-course meal.

Very fun !!! Great waiter was so good at explaining the menus to our large group. Definitely plan for it taking a little longer do to the uniqueness of the dinner. It's a little more expensive but a fun treat to have once and awhile.

I don't give 5 stars very often. 

Let me just start by saying that this dining adventure takes a while. Our reservation was at 715 and we left at 930. There are multiple courses and cooking times for your food. (The proteins are all delivered raw and you cook them yourself in the fondue pot.)

As long as your are comfortable with the fact that it is expensive, it takes a while to have the full experience, and that it is interactive (requires you to do your own cooking in the proteins) then you really should not have anything to complain about. As long as you know what you're in for, you'll have an amazing time.

As far as the quality of the food, the staff, the atmosphere and the flavors, I can only say one thing: DYNAMITE. 

I have had more expensive meals in my life. Price does not dictate the quality of a meal. Everything adds up to be the best date night, special occasion, etc that my money can buy. Any time I want a special dining experience The Melting Pot is #1, #2, #3 on my list every single time. I just can't say enough positive things about it. If you think it's too good to be true, go find out for yourself. It's not and you'll thank me later.

We've been here before, but quite some time ago - - and we've been to many other places since then.  Went for a Birthday/Father's Day celebration.  The evening was exactly the treat I was hoping for!  Fun, friendly and attentive staff.  Our sever, Michael gets a special shout out.  Great service from start to finish.  We were 100% pleased with the pacing, quality and presentation of our "Endless Entree" meal.  A couple people in our party had some special requests, and the manager was very accommodating.  Didn't get the Manager's name, but he seems like the kind of guy who knows what's going on with every table, and doesn't hesitate to do his part to make sure the staff has what they need and the customers get a high end experience.  Final observation - - this is a format that demands a lot of the staff.  They are well trained and work really hard.  Great job - - we'll be back!

I'm visiting Scottsdale from the San Francisco bay area and decided to meet up with a friend here for dinner tonight. I LOVE fondue and was looking forward to my dinner here for a while.

First of all, we had an AWESOME server named Nate. He knew the menu very well and was very attentive to our needs. To top it off, he was very handsome too! I appreciated that he was such a great server to us despite the fact that we shared our entree and didn't order much.

3/4 into our meal the manager came by to check on us too! That was also a very nice touch and shows that this restaurant really cares about their customer satisfaction. I've dined at the San Mateo and Irvine Melting Pot in the past and this place is the best one I've tried.

The Fiesta Cheese Fondue is awesome! We also enjoyed the bursting, spicy flavor of the French Quarter entree consisting of Shrimp, Filet, chicken and sausage! The dipping sauce are all delicious. It's hard to choose which one to use. 

Although I was here with my friend, I would have LOVED the privacy their little booths for two offer. They even have curtains for you and the staff will warn you before they open them to serve your food. Very romantic idea! Outside is a cute little fire pit too!

This is definitely a great place for a date or to celebrate anniversaries. Besides, fondue is fun!

So another first for me and I must say my girls and I very much enjoyed our experience here.  I read all the reviews last night knowing we would be dining here the next evening.  The only complaints I really worried about were the small portions but that was no where near an issue....we have never left a restaurant more full!

When we entered we were very pleasantly greeted and shown to the booth we had reserved right away.  Our server Laura was quick to greet us and explain the menu, choices and her suggestions.

Let my girls order virgin strawberry daiquiris and I ordered one for myself as well and they were delicious!

We decided to go with the 4 course meal for $40.50 a person and it was a great deal.  We started with the Wisconsin cheese fondue which was amazing.  With the green onions, scallions and black pepper, white wine and dry sherry.  The only complaint we had was you could taste the alcohol a little too much in the cheese, which when dining with kids was a bit bothersome.  I didn't like the veggies in the cheese, just didn't seem like a good combo to me.  I would prefer to see just a larger variety of bread instead of 2 choices. All in all the cheese fondue was delicious.

The salads were very good as well.  One of my girls went with the sweet dressing as opposed to the peppercorn ranch on the Melting Pot house salad and she didn't eat any of it.  Said the dressing was way too sweet.  I very much liked my house salad with the peppercorn ranch.  Not a ton of croutons, a very good even amount of everything. The salad was crisp and fresh and not drowned in dressing.  Was happy with this course as well.

On to the main course!  We had shrimp, herb chicken, pork, sirloin and teriyaki steak.  The teriyaki steak, shrimp and sirloin were very good, fresh and tender.  We did not care for the herb chicken at all.  The pork was good as well but I believe was a teriyaki pork and the taste was very overwhelming.  Only trouble with ordering a main course is each piece takes anywhere from a minute and 30 seconds to 2 to 3 minutes to cook so it is very tiring cooking everything.  My suggestion is to get a rhythm going.  You get 2 fondue forks, while you have one in the pot cooking something eat what is on your plate...then when you are done the next thing is ready to come out.  While we enjoyed the main course we all agreed we wouldn't do it again.  Next time would just come for the cheese and dessert.

Speaking of dessert!!  Delish!!  We went with the original blend, the chocolate and chunky peanut butter.  Wish our pot had been turned up a little higher so it was a little warmer but I could have asked as well and I am sure they would have done it.  We ate it so fast though it didn't matter too much!  The rice krispy treats, marshmallows, brownies, pound cake, cheesecake and strawberries were out of this world!!  By the time we left we were all ready to go home and sleep!

Overall we were very happy with our experience here.  A manager came by at the end of our meal and made sure everything had been to our liking.  Every person of the service staff we encountered was very nice and helpful.

One of the only negative I would have to say about the atmosphere is I think it should be a certain age and above, this is not a kid type restaurant.  While trying to enjoy our meal there was a child, perhaps a little under the age of two who found it funny to make the same loud yelling noise over and over for about 20 mins.  Not his fault but parents need to either correct the behavior, leave this age of child at home when dining here or go to a more family type place to eat.  I would encourage the managers to be more aware of this as well, it would have been nice for one of them to take the initiative and ask about quieting the child for their other customers. 

We will be returning to the establishment as overall it was a fabulous and fun experience that everyone should have.  Yes it is pricey but I believe worth the money as you will go home stuffed and satisfied!

Food was mediocre, and the service was AWFUL. 
The bathrooms looked like they hadn't been cleaned in a week, and they smelled SO bad!!! I lost my appetite after using the restroom.  
I mentioned the bathrooms needed to be cleaned to the manager, and he just nodded at me and walked away. No apology, didn't say they would clean them ASAP, nothing. The booths and wallpaper look like they came out of a cheap motel. The decorations they put up for Valentines were literally from the DOLLAR STORE. This is supposed to be a 5 star restaurant. 

When we go and spend $200 for the two of us on a Holiday, we expect excellent service and food, but we would have gotten better service and food at APPLEBEES. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE.
I don't recomend if you are really hungry, portions are very small, and price is insulting. I would recomend Hiro Sushi over Melting Pot

Purchased the Groupon to try this place out. Took my girlfriend to have a nice dinner. When we arrived, I found there was plenty of parking space and in a really nice area. We were greeted immediately. There were no problems with our reservations. We chose a curtain booth, which, not surprisingly, is a booth with a curtain. The booth was pretty small, along with the table. Not too much room to eat or move plates around. But once you receive the delicious food, it doesn't matter. All the food was well put together and in generous servings, and the waitstaff was very intentive. They even accommodated a request for candles at the table. This is not a cheap place, but definitely worth it. I will be back in the future for more fondue deliciousness!!!
Three years in a row....every anaversary.....this place rocks!! You will spend 2 quality hrs with the one u love enjoying food and company in private booths. Love this place

Fantastic experience!! The food, the service, everything was absolutely amazing. Our server, Joe was so great! We will definitely be coming back to see him. We dine at melting pot often and this was our favorite visit. Thanks Joe, we will be back soon!

I went here because there was a living social deal (or maybe it was groupon). Either way, the prices are so outrageous that I never wanted to check the place out. 
It was a fun experience and the food was good - I wouldn't go back again based on their normal prices (you're easily spending at least $120 for two people), but if there were another "deal" offer, I would go back. 
It's definitely worth trying at least once, just for the experience and the food is good too (but not amazing or anything).

This place brings a lot of key ingredients to the table, in terms of fun experience. This place would be excellent for kids that love to experience cooking their own food as well as fun for adults. My girlfriend and I use the time in between cooking to catch up on conversation, so we certainly draw out our cooking to enjoy each other more & it brings about a very nice ambiance, with the private booths as well as the fireplace they have. I highly recommend this place for a date night but only if you can handle cooking your own food.

This restaurant is so cool! It is so fun that you get to cook your own food in the melting pot! However it is kind of pricey, especially because they're not even cooking your food! But the food is delicious! I loved the spinach cheese dip and the smores  dessert! I will definitely go back

This place is way over hyped! Went for birthday and all the little plates they bring to dip into fondues are all very, very, very low quality. The novelty of having to basically prepare your main course by cooking it yourself in the fondue was pretty gross. I didn't realize that I'd have to cook my own dinner by sticking the skewers with raw meat
Into the pot, so gross. It's so expensive and I'd much rather have a fine chef prepare my dinner. When we walked into the restaurant it smelled so strong like bleach I thought I'd be sick. At 6:45 pm they were scrubbing at entrance with bleach. So gross. This place gets two stars for the novelty but it was pretty horrible. Don't spend the money! I'm really surprised I didn't get food poisoning!

L. took me out for a belated birthday dinner this evening here. I had yelped it prior and was pretty excited for what seemed to be a "one of a kind" experience.

As soon as we walked in, I was wowed by the atmosphere. Definitely very Scottsdale-y, but not super snotty. Just very nice and sophisticated. There's definitely a lot of explanation that is involved throughout the evening, which sort of went over my head which was ok because L had been there before. 

We had the Big Night Out - and I sub'd the lettuce wrap with the chicken caesar salad. Our server warned me about the pine nuts in case I was allergic, which I'm not. But the pine nuts were bomb and definitely made the salad special. We had the fondue fusion (with lobster), and the original for dessert. Add on a few drinks between the two of us, and it was SO MUCH FOOD BUT OMGAHD SO GOOD. If I had a six-figure salary, I would be here all the time it's redick. 

It's definitely one of those special occasion places, a lot of the parties that came in after us were celebrating an anniversary or birthday. The service was great and I'll definitely be back....gotta start saving though.

Very good food. I liked the cheese fondue (classic). We also shared a meat, mushroom and lobster one. The dipping sauce for the veggies was good. The curry one for the steak was good, the others not so much. Charging for the cooking method is kinda weird. The chocolate fondue was delicious, loved the dipping options and variety.  Our waitress was super nice. The ambiance is off , it felt like a vegas chapel, it felt strange I cant put my finger on it....

I'm not quite sure what it is with fancy restaurants and dim lights but I found it hilarious that a couple at a neighboring table was using the light from their smart phones to read the menu.  Anyway.

Waited around for the Groupon to try out this place, which came highly recommended by my friends, and it was pretty good.  My boyfriend and I got the salad and entree Groupon for two, but the portions were, in my opinion, rather small.  However, I'm not sure if this goes for the regular menu as well, or if it's just one of the limitations of using a Groupon.  On a side note, the four-courses-for-$40 menu insert had my favorite phrase, "all you can eat", but I'm not sure if there was any fine print to it.

On top of the Groupon, we got two servings of the dark chocolate fondue, and it was delicious - it beat our entrees hands-down.  But again, I wish there was more.

Would I come back?  It was definitely a nice slow dinner with mediocre service and good food in minute portions.  But without the Groupon, I probably won't be back, unless that 4 course dinner was truly, in every sense of the word, unlimited.

My wife and I went here for our Anniversary, and , as always, enjoyed it immensely!! Service is outstanding, and it is such a great evening.. Love the choices you have, and the various courses. If you want something special to do for a restaurant, this is your place!!

I decided to go out with some friends here for my 30th birthday and I am so glad we did! It was my husband and 2 other couples, and we sat in a nice, private booth and had the BEST time. We had 2 LivingSocials and got quite a deal. That's always a plus! The server was terrific and really added to our enjoyment. I like how they don't rush you out of there and really expect you to stay all evening. And we did - for over 3 hours!!! We got to try two cheeses, broths, and desserts since there were 6 of us so that was awesome. I had a really great time!

We have been here only twice and both times we had a good time. Service was good, food seems very good quality, and it is overall a very fun experience.
Make sure to make a reservation and expect to spend about 2 hours here if you go for the 4 course meal. I would recommend you go for it because is the one that offers more value, in my opinion. $54 per person plus drinks, tax and tip, for the Charity option that includes 4 courses with endless main course.
Well, not sure if it can be considered endless as I guess they do not refill the broth once the level is lowered, but it is still a good meal.
If you are not familiar with the concept, the charity option includes cheese fondue with bread and vegetables, salad, main entrée cooked in broth, and the chocolate fondue option for dessert.
This is a nice place to celebrate a special occasion, you can ask for a private booth if available.

Okay, first of all, this is kinda pricey so it's not the place I'd go weekly.  However, a few times a year this place is awesome!  They have a gluten free menu and they do host special gluten free nights at Scottsdale,  where this time, they featured Jewel's Cupcakes (soon to be bakery cafe) desserts and bread.  The second time there was a special night with a percentage of proceeds going to the Celiac Foundation.  Win/win!  

First time there we had the four course meal which included the salad.  I was thinking that I wouldn't want the salad in deference to the main pot but I am telling you that this was one of the best salads I have EVER had in my life.  Seriously.  That good!  It was a specific menu for that season so I cannot remember what salad it was but it was divine!

The cheese fondue is good.  I have found after two trips it is okay, not my favorite though and IF I had to ixnay one course the cheese would be the first to go.  The Mojo pot for the main course may set you back another $6 bucks but it's totally worth it.  The flavors are awesome!  When they bring all the veggies, do yourself a favor and have them add them all in immediately to the pot.  The potatoes take forever to cook and the flavor is more prevalent after a longer cook time. 

the Mushrooms are fantastic with the Gorgonzola dip.  The green goddess dip goes best with the broccoli and I love the plum sauce for shrimp and the chicken though the curry dip is good for chicken as well.  I don't do red meat so the hubs ate the beef and pork and I did the chicken and shrimp.  Nicely done!

Dessert chocolate.  I've had both the peanut butter chocolate and the Turtle.  GET THE TURTLE!  Both are good but the turtle is to die for.  Combine that with Jewel'sCupcake (soon to be cafe) gluten free espresso cream puffs and brownies and cheesecake...........foodgasm!  Seriously.  Better than, well you get the idea.

I wish they carried Jewel's items all the time to dip with.  Even her main course bread put into the chocolate was nom nom!

GO...........celebrate something.  Enjoy the atmosphere........dark, quiet.  Plan on spending three or four hours............of luxury eating!

I went here to celebrate getting a new job with my fiancé. Food was excellent and service was very personable. It is a little bit on the pricey side and I recommend getting a reservation, but it's not a place you would go to once a week. It's more of a special occasion joint.

My husband and I went to celebrate our 18th wedding anniversary. We had never been to a restaurant like this. We had made some cheese fondue at home and figured we would give it a try. We had a great experience, The food was delicious. Our server was GREAT. He was very knowledgable and helped us through the process. Cant wait to go back.

Poor service and cramped feet space under the table made this experience less then I had expected.  I was also a bit upset that they included a gratuity on the check and I was not able to control how much i tipped the bad service we got.
Mediocre food.  Bad service.  Cheesecake Factory food and ambiance.

We have gone here several times. The menu has been changed completely . The filet was tough and did not have the flavor of a filet. Meat had gristle in it.Cheese was good, Bread was very hard and dry. Server was excellent. We split a entree and were charged extra for the oil that used to be included.Also charged extra for the same amount of chocolate that you normally get for one.Has become very pricey.

I would much rather have someone cook for me... but that's just me. Not an every month venture but perhaps you need to visit occasionally! 
Great service!

This is one of my absolutely favorite places to eat. Here is my guide to having a 5 star experience at this restaurant. 

1. Make reservations a few weeks in advance to be sure to get the time slot you are interested it. They fill up fast.

2. Go for an occasion, not a holiday. Go because its your birthday, or you are celebrating a big business deal. Not on Valentines Day. This is not me saying it would be bad on Valentine's Day, but most people get frustrated when its busy at places like this and don't realize that, well, yeah...its VALENTINE'S DAY. (If you can set the right expectations then HECK YEAH go on Valentine's Day)

3. DO NOT and I repeat DO NOT take your kids here. It is not that the staff wouldn't be amazing to your kids, it is the fact that most people are here for a quiet night out, not a screaming 2 year old. (I leave my screaming 2 year old at home.) Here's the catch, if your kid is old enough to enjoy a good meal and experience and you would like some one on one time with them to perhaps congratulate them on good grades etc, this may not be a bad idea. Again...screaming 2 year old = NO.

4. Finding deals for this place is also a good tip. Sometimes you will see coupons in your local mailer, or you can sign up for their newsletter. If not prepare yourself for a high bill. Same as when you go to Fogo de Chao. You know you are going to a nice place, you also know you are paying for it. Go in with a good mindset and be expecting it and it wont shock you, either that or drink some of their fabulous cocktails and then you wont care!

5. Booths with privacy curtains. Don't ask. However be aware that they do have them and they can be fun. (Assuming here, I have never sat in one).

6. Last but not least and most important. I do not care if you are on a diet, or diabetic, or hate chocolate (what kind of nut are you). Make time, don't eat for a week, take insulin, and have the chocolate fondue. This is absolutely amazing and worth the trip every time!

Follow my 6 steps and you will have a great time at The Melting Pot!

Dessert is my absolute favorite and I'd have it first every time if I weren't with people who like to do things "the normal way".  

 If you are gonna do the Melting Pot, do it right! Go all out and don't look at the bill! This isn't a place for cheap-o's.  

If you are in a hurry, this also isn't the place for you.  Expect at least two hours here!

If you expect your food to be served cooked, you are in for a treat!  You cook your own food here, hence the "Fondu" part. 

I've been to the one in Scottsdale and they even offer "private booths" with little curtains so you can't see the naughty things people do with fondu! In any case, you will need reservations, this place fills up fast!

Beginners:  You get to your table and you are presented with an crazy menu.  First order the type of cheese fondu you want.  Then you order your salads, your main entree (if you bring a guy, order extra and LET HIM KNOW you cook your own food here). It can take a while, so order an appetizer or something because you can get hungry waiting.  The meets and veggies are cut skewer size so it cooks pretty fast.

Cheese Fondu: I suggest the Spinach Artichoke Cheese
Cooking Fondu: The Coq Au Vin
Dessert:- I'm biased because I get the same one everytime - Chocolate S'mores. I'd lick that damn fondu pot like licking is going outta style!

Old timers: You know the drill - have you tried theBIg Night Out?  Its probably the best deal around.

The questionable:  The wait time in between courses and then waiting to eat my courses.  I guess that's the whole point. Savor, right? I think the meat portions could be more generous, but that could be me being a porker.

Bottom Line:  GET DESSERT. GET DESSERT. GET DESSERT!

The fondue style is kind of fun and the service is outstanding. The food it's self was not real exciting. The "Cheddar Cheese" fondue was no where near cheese - I'm not sure what it was. My husband and his buddy had one drink and then were cut off. Our friend is a little loud and flamboyant so maybe they thought he was drunk. Anyway, it was kind of a bummer for my birthday. The place is ultra quiet. Maybe it's supposed to be romantic, but I think it would great for families and kids.

Yes this place is expensive but that's why it's a nice elegant fancy place to eat!  They give you endless  fruit or bread for your cheese fondu. The service was awesome! I didn't like the main dish I ordered because it wasn't what I was expecting, and he gladly took it back and gave me what my boyfriend ordered. Not to mention it came out so fast!

This place is intimate, great for date night with the boy! Or date night with a girl! 

If you sign up on their website, they give you free chocolate fondu for two next time you go there. You have to order cheese fondu an 2 meals but that's still awesome!

Do you know how in high school, if you don't have the money (or are too cheap to spend it) for a fancy prom date?  Well, if you know, then you know you choose a fake fancy restaurant, that let's folks wear jeans, charges too much, and gives too little.  You know?  Well, that's The Melting Pot.

We were fortunate to buy a Groupon on sale, but that's not to say we felt those precious dollars were spent well.  The discount still left us feeling like we over paid.  While the food was good, the prices are ridiculously inflated.  Had I paid full price for the vegetarian entree I ordered, it would have been $25 for 4 halves of artichoke heart, 4 tofu wedges, 4 slices of mushroom, 4 asparagus stalks and 4 raviolis.  $25 is half my weekly budget in groceries.  Sorry, this ain't no prom date.

The lighting is very low and the atmosphere feels posh, kind of sleek.  So, again, some fancy feeling for you.  Apparently reservations are highly suggested (why people line up, I just don't know).  We sat at the bar, albeit comfortably.

Still, our server was pleasant and helpful.  Nothing out of the ordinary.  An attempt here and there to up sale, a smile, a description of what's in our "melting pot."

Overall, if you want to stab your food, feel fancy, and eat very little, this is the place for you.  I really don't know why anyone would spend the money it costs to eat here, when there are other options, but, if you like pretense of a prom date, this is a right fit for you.

This place is great!  I've been several times, with my husband as well as with girlfriends.  It's good for either occasion.  Girls can go and chat and catch up, and it's also good for a romantic dinner.  It does take a while to eat, and is pricey, but you get your money's worth.  The waiters are fantastic, very helpful.  They don't rush you through your meal, you can take as long as you'd like with each course.

They have a four course meal for two, about $90, that is great.  Cheese, salad, main course and chocolate for dessert.  This is the way to go.

Just finished dinner for twelve at melting pot. Had a lot of fun service was excellent. It was a busy night but they did great. Veggies were fresh salads were crisp and the meat was lean and nicely seasoned  staff was excellent.  Mille and Greta were really exceptional.

I went here about a year ago with a friend and enjoyed it. Nice staff, good food and was pleased. I have a group of friends from work that we rotate selecting a restaurant to out eat at. I decided on The Melting Point as my choice and phoned the restaurant to place the reservation. The guy taking the reservations could hardly be heard or understood--there was no accent just a rushed feeling to get off the phone.

I explained there would be a party of 8 people dining for dinner. I was told I needed to provide a credit card to hold the reservation and if we were late or no-shows a $10 per person charge would be applied. WHAT!?!

Needless to say, I contacted my friends and picked another restaurant that doesn't pull these kinds of tricks. Sorry Melting Pot, but that's a bit rude and a good way to drive off repeat customers.

Definitely a fun date spot because you get plenty of time to chat with each other and the atmosphere is dark and intimate.  But in my opinion, it's just too much cheese.  And you cook everything yourself. And it can be a little messy.  And it's pricey. 

But at the same time, the food is good, so I can't say anything against it.  It's just not my cup o' tea.

The dessert is very good as well, but you will fo sho leave here feeling as if you've ate waaaay too much.  Most likely because you did!

Came in for my anniversary dinner with the love of my life. Spent a wonderful evening indulging in dark chocolate with Grand Mariner, strawberries and cheesecakes. Our entree was a phenomenal duck and filet mignon. The only thing that made this already decadent meal better was the accompaniment of our waiter Anthony, he was like a Sherpa through our flavor journey. I can not stress enough how impeccable Anthony was with his guidance on taste and meal selection, from our bottle of wine to broth style Anthony was a guiding light that enhanced this flavor process.

Manager was very unfriendly. We had to wait around 20 minutes to be seated, despite we had a reservation and the restaurant was half-empty. After the wait we were given the most horrible seat in the middle of everything. waiter was completely stressed out, unshaven and not very friendly. Always disappeared , never checked on us or refilled our water. Waiter was unaware of the wine flights and the special menus offered. Overall, I will never return to this Melting Pot again.

I was a little sad because the anniversary stuff I was supposed to get was not as nice as previous pics. And they didn't have our promised strawberries. But the staff was very nice and the food was really good.
Me and my husband went here to celebrate our big move to Arizona. It was absolutely amazing, we got a romantic package and they came to our table to take a picture.

My daughter and I go here every Thursday. We always have the Cheese and Chocolate dinner. The price is very reasonable and the waiters, especially, Izzy, are great! They prepare the fondue right at your table and they will replenish the dipping items as often as you like. Try the cheddar, garlic, and beer sauce for the cheese portion and the half milk, half dark chocolate for the dessert part. Best dinner in town.

I LOVE THE MELTING POT. I honestly don't get what other people are talking about when they say they leave this place hungry...  or that they have bad service... or that they think the food is gross... are we talking about the same restaurant here? When people complain about how it takes 2-3 hours to eat... do they realize that fondue is not standard dining? I'm genuinely confused. Every experience (about 10-15) I've had at this Melting Pot has been great. If you're looking for a romantic, slow, tranquil night out with delicious food - you will not be disappointed here.

There are so many things I enjoy about the Melting Pot, and this location in particular. It's the perfect place for a romantic date or celebration, and you can request one of the more private booths with curtains when you make your reservation - they are so intimate and cozy! I also love that they have happy hour and random deals throughout the year; in May, my boyfriend and I took advantage of the "endless entree" special and I can honestly say I've never eaten more filet mignon than I did that night! Also, I'm not sure if most people think to come here for "just" an appetizer or "just" dessert - but it is very affordable if you do (especially during happy hour). Like 99% of people, my favorite course is definitely the chocolate fondue. You simply can't go wrong with melted chocolate, fruits, cheesecake, pound cake, and rice krispy treats. You just can't.

The service at this location has always been top-notch. I always feel as if I'm royalty when dining here! I love it. It is truly a unique experience that you won't get at a standard restaurant. I have never felt put off by the hostesses or servers and every time I've dined here, the manager has come up to my table to make sure everything is okay. 

If you decide to dine here, I highly suggest making a reservation as they fill up quickly on weekends and holidays. Also, check out the specials they have (which are on their website) to make sure you're getting the most cost-efficient option.

Overpriced for mediocre food. It's the novelty that you pay for.
We did the Four Course option, add lobster.
Nothing blew me away, except my company.  :)
I'm glad I experienced it once, but probably won't go back for dinner. (Dessert, possibly.)

I love fondue, but I'm not coming back to this restaurant. 

I had dinner here on a Wednesday at 6:30pm and was really disappointed by how rushed the experience felt. The place couldn't have been more than half full, but corporate must have told them to turn the tables more quickly. Our server didn't really come check on how we were doing, but every time he arrived I felt like a kid who hadn't done my homework - I don't know what I want for my next course! I just started eating what's in front of me. I told him twice to give us more time to decide, but I should have been more assertive. 

The part of dinner I had looked forward to most was the blackberry lemonade, and that was a fail. I wanted nonalcoholic and should have specified. The server could have clarified or noticed I didn't drink it and asked if I needed something else. Instead we didn't have time to talk about it until after the bill so I paid $8 for a drink I couldn't drink. I should have insisted he take it off the bill, and he should have offered but, like I said, he was trying to get us out of there ASAP and we were gone by 7:15pm (not exactly closing time). 

I go out to dinner for a relaxing evening of good food and conversation, and everyone was polite, but the speed of the experience made me feel unwelcome.

The Melting Pot is soooo goooood.  And it's such a great place to go with friends.  I've been several times and would recommend it for birthdays, New Years, special meals, whatever!

I love the Wisconsin Trio for the cheese fondue and the Lobster Indulgence for dinner.  For dessert, I like Yin and Yang.  

Be prepared to spend well over $100 for a couple though.  It ain't cheap.  That and you'll want to be sure you have a reservation as this place is always packed.

The man who greeted us (who I assume was the manager) had a bit of an attitude. We came later in the evening and he seemed pretty annoyed. But our server was super sweet, attentive, and made conversation with us. We were visiting from New York and we had been to The Melting Pot in White Plains so we wanted to try this one. This restaurant is a bit pricey but if you're looking to splurge a little more on dinner, especially if it's an occasion, I recommend The Melting Pot! Also cool that you get to cook your entrees yourself!

This is one of the very few chain restaurants I like...

Tried this new location on Saturday night (they recently moved into a new bigger building next door). 

Melting Pot is an adventure in dining, a prolonged multi-hour dinner experience. I love fondue, and The Melting Pot are the masters of fondue!

Started with cheese, apples, breads, and veggies with a cheddar cheese and beer concoction. Moved on to lobster, shrimp, steak, pork, and chicken which we cooked in a veggie broth. Finished the meal with a chocolate and peanut butter dip with cheesecake, strawberries, and rice crispy treats.

Great service, great food, great wine list, great times!

The melting pot has a beautiful ambiance and a lovely setting for couples who want privacy. I like the booths that are closed off by the curtains as well as the flavorful menu, what I liked best was the meat selection, especially the steak. The desert was not bad, but I recommend getting it if you really have a taste for it at the time. Will highly recommend to anyone

I want to be clear when I say that service was very very good     We had a very fun evening but with what we thought was confusing  on the menu there were five of us eating or just 4 cocktails at our bill including tip was around $400      I left there and as the night progressed I really felt like we were taking advantage of and I'm very disappointed but probably won't go back     I make a pretty good salary but I do know that that kind of money must be for an exceptional dinner and this was no exception but very nice      Very disappointed in involved with Dry bread and not the highest quality meats       I considered reversing the charge on my credit card but my husband said that would be the wrong thing to do.  I feel it's on the contrary     Definitely feel a little bent over the couch     We were so excited because in the past our Experience was so much better.  No more melting pot for us. :(

As a first time goer I found my experience a bit unsettling. I was waiting on refills of soda and water on two separate occasions throughout my night. The process was explained to me very poorly and it was quite rushed. I found my self confused more often than I found myself in a state of satisfaction. The portions were subpar and the service was no better. My broth where you cook your meats was sitting boiling for over 20 minutes before we actually got the meats which got me curios as to if it was still at the peak of deliciousness and maximum flavor. My wife and I did enjoy the scrumptious desserts, that was the highlight of the night but the competition wasn't too stiff.

We love this place.

The atmosphere is great. It's really gorgeous in there.

The food is amazing. Dessert is even more amazing.

We can't afford to go here often, but it's wonderful for special dates like anniversaries. I love it.

HORRIBLE SERVICE.
We got there & let the hostess know it would be a total of 8 adults and 2 kids. She automatically said they couldnt do that and that they didn't have the availability. When you could clearly look around and see the place was EMPTY. As soon as the manager went over to greet us her attitude changed and she said how she had told us it would be 5-10 min. I then pointed out how that is not what she had told us & the manager took me to choose where we would like to sit. 
After we took our seats, the worst part began. The server was just bad, he sucked. He was loud and rude. Not to mention that he would take 3 times the time it usually takes but then hurried us out at the end. 
You do not get the service you pay for.

I wouldn't recommend this location to ANYONE. Stuck up, snotty. rude staff. Never plan on going back.

I have been to all 3 Locations and have never been disappointed! 
Stopped by with friends and service was fast and friendly, with a couple of special requests handled with a smile. 
Great food, just be prepared for the concept of 'cooking' your own food and know where the Timer is on you Phone Clock!

I had never been to The Melting Pot and when the girlfriend found a coupon in the mail, she thought it'd be a fun night out.

We went on a Thursday, to keep the cost "down" a bit. We did the Big Night Out special at $69, she had an $8 glass of wine and I had a $2.50 iced tea. The meal started with the regular cheddar cheese fondue, which tasted great. They bring out as many dippers as you want, but we exhausted the cheese in one go.

Next up were the salads. I had a house salad with the peppercorn ranch which was tasty and she had a California salad, which included gorgonzola and a raspberry vinaigrette. I'm not a fan of bleu-type cheeses, but the dressing really sold it.

The main course was part of their island/pacific inspired seasonal special. The platter included chicken, beef, pork tenderloin, kiwi shrimp, pasta, and ahi tuna. It didn't appear to be a ton of food, but it definitely filled us up--we even left a few pieces to spare. We had it with the coq au vin oil.

Finally, we tried the bananas foster chocolate fondue, but with dark chocolate instead. Our server flambee'd the bananas and sprinkled cinnamon into the mix which made sparks. Very cool. They served strawberries, rice krispies, marshmallows, brownies, cheesecake, and pound cake. A great assortment.

Our waiter was informed, helpful, and attentive. Our booth was an intimate two person right-angle type table, which was nice, but a bit claustrophobic. 

At the end of the day, the food was tasty but it didn't wow me. I've had amazing meals. Meals that leave you wanting to tell the story, shouting about them from the rooftops. Meals with superb presentation, wonderful experimentation, and the results of a master chef who has truly honed his craft and knows just what to put together and how best to accomplish it. I've had that for far less than $110 (tax & tip) for two people, too.

The value proposition component really sticks with me here. The food was good, but it wasn't phenomenal. It wasn't life-changing. The presentation was nice, the seasonings were good, things were flavorful, but at the end of the day, I didn't leave with a sense of awe and utter contentment. I was full, and I was happy, but I expect a whole lot more when I dip into the $100/couple range for a meal.

Now, to be fair, you get four courses. More than enough food. It's a romantic setting (with somewhat varied music) and they execute the concept very well. I guess I was disappointed because I want a story to tell when I spend that much money on a meal, and I didn't get one.

We had a great dinner here on a Tuesday night!

We made reservations (not that they were totally necessary) and were promptly seated upon our arrival. 

Our waiter Ralph was awesome from the beginning. Super friendly, walked us through the process and menu, remembered our drinks and was attentive. 

We opted for the four course meal (cheese fondue, salad, main course, chocolate fondue) as I am sure most people do. We kept it pretty basic with our selections: Wisconsin Cheddar, Land and Sea (filet mignon, chicken breast, and shrimp), and pure milk chocolate. 

The cheddar fondue was great. You get three types of bread, apples, carrots, celery, olives, salami and some more assorted vegetables of various nature to dip.   

Once you are done with your first course, the salads come out. We had Caesar and spinach and apple. They were average side salads. A nice touch to break up your fondue sessions though. 

Then it's on to the main. You pick what kind of boiling seasoning you want essentially and then your main dishes come out raw. We were advised how long to cook everything for and away you go. 

The filet and chicken were solid. The shrimp was meh but I didn't expect much anyways. Again, to me this part of the meal is to break up the richer fondues and get you some protein. It was definitely enjoyable but don't come here if you are looking for an amazing steak. 

Then, finally, the best part: dessert. Our dipping selection included strawberries, banana, pineapple, rice crispys, funfetti cake, brownies, blondes, marshmallows, raspberry and blackberries, and cream puffs. Each item was to die for after dipping in the milk chocolate. If I were to pick only one course to have... it's this one. I mean cmon. The coffee was pretty good too. 

I never felt rushed during our meal. We were there for a little over two hours, and our waiter let us know that's about how long the four course meal would run at the beginning which was nice. It's a good meal if you want to take it slow and chat while eating smaller plates. 

This is a pricey place and you are paying some for the novelty but I don't think that takes away from your meal at all, unless you are super picky. I would come here to celebrate an occasion or if you want to try something different and enjoy a longer meal.
Good but very pricey. Our server Alli was excellent, friendly, and knowledgeable. Overall a very good experience and a cozy dining room!

We ordered the "fondue for 2"....it was WAYYYYY too much food.  and i hate wasting food especially if i cant take it home.  Come on a double date, this place isnt as romantic as you'd think it would be anyway...lots of families there.  The atmosphere feels like a steakhouse too.  I have since bought a fondue set of my own and we do it at home often.  Way more fun (and easier on the wallet).
Fun experience, but can get pricey. Really enjoy the cheese and the chocolate. I am happy to skip the salads and the main course.

Buyer Beware!!  Be prepared to drop more $$ than you anticipate with your local dine coupon.  The coupon was $50 for the four course big night out dinner for two.  What they don't tell you is it really costs $83 for this meal.  So.....we spent $25 on the coupon for $50.  You will pay the difference on this deal, plus drinks and they add a $20 tip on top of this (for you to cook your own dinner!!).  We felt totally ripped off when we got the bill for $79.63!  This is a VERY misleading coupon.  We have not had this problem with others from local dines.  Needless to say, we will not go back to the Melting Pot again, nor recommend this place.  Local Dines needs to be more specific with the coupons and what you are really getting.  Also we had a private booth which was nice and cozy, however the music was very loud and not anything we like to listen to (old torch songs), we asked them to turn down the volume three times and it was still too loud in our booth!!

My boyfriend and I went to the melting pot for our Valentine's day dinner this year and we were quite disappointed... 

The service was annoying.  Our waiter kept trying to joke with us, he shared far too much personal information, and he was sweating into our fondue while making it...

The ambiance is dark... Too dark, I could barely see my smoking hot date.

The food was mediocre, lacking any flavor whatsoever.  The bread was stale, the vegetables were borderline rotten, and the meats were TOUGH and bland...

Really, the only thing remotely tasty was the dessert.  We got the plain milk chocolate... kind of hard to mess up... and we received about 1/4 of a cup of it... pretty skimpy portion if you ask me.

The Melting Pot was TERRIBLE.  Please do not go here.  Save yourself the bill and make fondue at home.  I expected so much more from this restaurant and was let down.

If you're into high priced gimmicks and constant snacking and dipping, this is the perfect alternative to an ACTUAL restaurant. 

There's so much dipping going on that You will even experience a dip in your bank account as you overpay for a bowl of vegetables and other inexpensive raw agricultural commodities. 

When you call to place a reservation they will express the importance of doing so, and then will tell you to just come in and not take your name down to ensure a lengthy wait upon arrival.

If you're with a party of 2, be prepared to dine in a phone booth that turns into a sauna as the boiling pot continues radiating heat and steam. The food is pretty good albeit unreasonably overpriced. I'd be lying if I didn't say it's a complete rip off.

It's very likely a good place to go to try and seduce an unwitting date with alcohol, gimmicks and sweet treats, just be prepared to empty your wallet.
Food was excellent! Atmosphere was wonderful! A fun experience! Service was mediocre but we would definitely return!

Service was great.  The pricing for value literally is insulting.  A small portion of bread, a pinch of vegetables, and a sad quarter of an apple with standard melted cheddar doctored up with bud light, garlic, seasoning, etc. = $18.

Almost upsetting how bad that experience remains.

I love this place! I went there with a group of friends for my boyfriends birthday on December 19,2013 and our waiter was excellent and so was the food! The only weird thing was having to cook your own food, but other than that it was great. Get the turtle chocolate fondu, it's to die for!

JANUARY 2017 (apologies for the posting delay)
Sadly, the overall experience was terrible, mainly because of poor/mis-management. Our waiter, Jake and bartender, Jason, were terrific (& we tipped very well). It was clear they were understaffed, and they did well given staff/management limitations. It was a surprise 50th birthday party (we were going "old school" fun!). I called the evening before to ensure all would go smoothly. When I talked to a manager on Tuesday (can't remember his name), I stated we may be 12 (OpenTable reservation was 10). He said, "No problem". GREAT! The Tuesday manager also said we would be in the party room, would have 4 burners (for the cheese/chocolate) and that we could walk around and mingle. PERFECT! 
That did not happen. The floor manager on Wednesday, Tony Bruno, decided differently: No Party room (he said it was too much trouble/electricity). He forced us (i.e. NO choice) to sit at a long, partitioned booth for 10 with 3 burners. We could not get in and out. We said more than 10 were coming. Tony said they could sit at the NEXT table (i.e. 3 feet away and bolted to the ground). He would not move us or accommodate. UNPROFESSIONAL! When the 11th person arrived, we had to pull up a 5th chair to the 4-top portion of the booth, meaning 5 customers had to share. 1 burner HORRIBLE! 
No movement. Less choice. Cramped in. Slow service (not because of Jake).  The only time Tony seemed attentive was when the checks arrived (4 of the 11 had to be corrected). 
Lastly, we arrived 10 minutes early. Tony said we could not get any service (e.g. drinks) before 6pm. Tony Bruno treated us as an inconvenience. As a business owner, I am confident that the Melting Pot owners/top-managers would not have been happy with how Tony handled any of this. 
It is sad. This was supposed to be a fun party. I believe there are now 11 very connected Scottsdale/Phoenix residents/ decision makers who will never return to The Melting Pot.
Mediocre food that is hysterically overpriced.  Living Social voucher was not valid for regular menu items; management utterly failed here. Slow service.

Okay so I'm just going to tell you this place is a must go to for any event! Melting pot was very clean, quite and very peaceful. I choose this place cause the overloads of great news I heard about the food! Not only is the food amazing but the server and other employees are very helpful.


Marcus was my server and I'll give him 5 stars he was great to us and answered any questions we had. He was very confident in the menu and questions that I asked him.

Not only am I going to tell people about this place but I believe I found a new spot to add to my weekly outing! 

Marcus and victor you guys ROCK!

Where do I start?  Hmm.  Okay, first of all, our server was fantastic.  In fact, the entire staff seems amazing.

Next?  Decor.  Slightly stuffy, dark, very "Scottsdale Formal Circa 2005."  What does that mean?  A sort of a cross between Tuscan, and French Provincial?  Whatever.  They did have super cute little (very little) curtained privacy booths for more intimate dining.  Honestly, that's kind of gross even though they're cute.
I mean, what are they DOING in there??

Food should probably be next.  And this is where it goes south.  You noticed the 1 star rating didn't you?

The cheese fondue was the Alpine, the dipping items were some very LARGE bread chunks, and some very SMALL granny smith apple pieces.  Verdict?  Skip it.  the nutmeg they add only really tastes good with the apples, and the fondue was grainy and whatever the opposite of smooth would be.  For some odd reason, the bread tasted TERRIBLE with it.  Maybe the bread should have been toasted?

Entree was the endless one with two kinds of beef, some chicken, shrimp, green raviolis, and a small bowl of veg.

The ravioli was vile, one of the shrimp was spoiled.  On the other hand, the chicken was fresh, and both cuts of beef were of good quality.  The nice thing about this entree is that you can ask for more of the items that you like.

The dipping sauces were hit and miss.  A couple were good, and the rest were a variety ranging from not good to vile.  It was a similar situation regarding the batters.  One was good.  The other?  Absolutely disgusting.

The big down side to the entree?  After a few minutes, the smell of the heated oil made me outright sick to my stomach.
On to the dessert.  We ordered the dark chocolate.  It came with some very small cubes of brownie and blondie (these were good), some very small cubes of pound cake (that tasted like the refrigerator), some rice krispy treat squares,  and some small banana slices.
The dark chocolate was grainy and insanely, ridiculously, SWEET. I love dark chocolate.  I love it in all of it's forms, but this?  Tasted like Hershey's chocolate sauce-but with sand and extra sugar in it.
I wouldn't go again even for free. I believe I will be washing dogs that evening instead.

This was my first time with my husband, I had heard it was over priced and that was definitely the case. The decor does need an update for sure. The service was great, the quality of food meh. The main course was good, the cheese in the appetizer was gritty and the wine's aftertaste was over powering. Our little bits of Apple came very brown and cut in tiney and giant pieces. The bread was stale and inconsistent in size. I felt like a duck getting old bread at the park. The dessert was good no doubt, but was 6 berries, a small piece of cheesecake and brownie bites. They added gratuity to the bill beforehand that was more than 20% and with water to drink a $220 bill!! There is no way this should cost this much. It's just not worth it.

Generally speaking the food is great so kudos to the kitchen.  The service at this one in particular has fallen off.  Our meal took 3 hours......the waiter kept completely shutting off the burners between courses so the burners had to completely warm up everytime. We asked for refills on our water about 17 times and they still couldn't seem to get us one refill. 

Oh and it's nice that they give you a Yelp check in deal but we had a $20 gift certificate  (on our $300 bill) so they would not honor the yelp free 3 strawberries to take home. Straight from the manager....lame.  

Try the Awauhtukee location.

Who can say no to dipping things in cheese? Who can say no to dipping things in chocolate? I decided to have a small gathering for my birthday, and I have never been here before and have always wanted to try. I pretty much knew I was going to enjoy the food before setting foot in the restaurant (again, cheese and chocolate). It would have to be something pretty awful to make me dislike that. Since we were a big enough party, we could try two types of cheese, broth for the main entree, and chocolates. Our server helped us navigate the process well. I don't have a single complaint, other than I couldn't order a second entree on the endless fondue because I was already popping buttons on my pants. So. Much. Food. I also appreciated their selection of local brews, although I have a suggestion for them if they ever want to expand (Sonoran White Chocolate, anyone?)

Would I go again? Definitely. I wouldn't get the 4-course meal, that is really pricey. Probably just separate cheese and chocolate selections. A great place to splurge now and again.

One of the best experiences in my life!!! Where do I start? I knew North Scottsdale is well known for all these fancy restaurants but I couldn't imagine the awesome experience...

My boyfriend took me here on a Sunday night. The place was not crowded, instead, quiet, romantic, slow-paced. (That's exactly what I like). Emily, the manager, immediately seated us. They mostly have both with an electric stove and a pot on it...you can imagine all the good food ahead of time! 

Ty was our server. He explained the menu, items, how the burner works, and recommended the endless 4-course menu where you can eat all you want. The Fiesta Cheese fondue was delicious! It was a long time since my last cheese fondue, I really enjoyed the combination of cheddar and jalapeño flavor. California salad was also really good. I liked this restaurant for the originality that they bring you different kinds of raw food (filet mignon, chicken, shrimp, veggies..) and you cook it right in the pot. Therefore Snobsdale ladies, do not complain about the food, cause you do most of the work at the table!! We paired this incredible menu with two glasses of Cabernet. 

I would say they saved the best for last. The caramel toffee chocolate fondue was my favorite part. Accompanied with strawberries, banana, marsh mellows and brownies. A chocoholic's dream coming true! Ty did a really good job!! I would request him next time we visit. If you're tired of the usual traditional place, go with the melting pot!! You won't get disappointed for sure! ;-)

This place brings out strong feelings among some of my friends.   My opinion?  It's fun, and kinda gives me a "I brought sexy back" feeling because I hosted fondue parties in high school for my friends.  Back then no one understood fondue.  Now they pay big $ for it.  I was fondue before fondue was cool.  But anyhow.....

One friend believes that this is the most fun EVER.  She loves this place like almost nothing else as a place to have a girls night.  

Another friend thinks it's ok, but unless you get one of the tables with the pot inside of it, it's not so great.  

My lactose intolerant but cheese loving friend thinks it's the devil.  She blames it for having an entire cheese course in front of her for 20 minutes so of course she had to eat it.  And as someone who carpooled with her on that occasion, I agreed.

And yet another friend thinks it's the biggest rip off she's ever seen.  I think it went something like this:
Her: So, they are giving you cut up veggies and stuff and you dip it into melted cheese?  Are they special veggies, or just what you could get at the store?
Me: Um, just normal.
Her: And they bring out raw meat for you to cook yourself?
Me: Um, yea...
Her: And if you forget which thing touched the raw meat and you end up putting that in your mouth it's not their fault if you die because they told you to be careful?
Me: I guess
Her: And this costs how much???

And it was at that point that she and I were on the same page.  So it can be fun, or evil or both (especially the chocolate course!  OH YEA!!!) but in the end there is a part of you that wonders why you paid all the money and did almost all the work.  And for a 3 course meal, you could be there 2 hours easily.  Fine if the date is going good, or you are w/ good friends, but not a good place for those "how soon will this be over" kind of dates...

My boyfriend and I went here for valentine's day. We were warned that we would be there for hours as the meal consisted of a lot of food. They were right! 
We went with the three or four course meal the restaurant was offering for the occasion, each course had a few limited options to choose from as it was the package deal. 
We chose and started off with a simple cheese fondue with a variety of deli meats and bread.  While I did not particularly enjoy the cheese fondue, (probably from the bitterness) my boyfriend really liked it. To each their own right? 
Next came our second course, I got the shrimp cocktail and my boyfriend got the salad. Boy was the sauce strong! But the the shrimp tasted fresh and was large and plump. 
For our third course we got a large pot of oil that came with a nice large amount of raw sample meat with a large variety if dips and sauces, such as steak, shrimp, heart shaped ravioli, vegetables etc.. I was in love with this spicy dipping sauce and had to ask for more!
It's important to note that this was all a meal for two, my boyfriend and I had to take our time as we were getting stuffed! We still had the dessert course which consisted or a  chocolate fondue with Bailey's liquor, served with a series of bite sized pastries and fresh fruit.
The reason I give this four stars is because after we were seated in the curtained couples booth, we sat idly for quite a while. We had thought we were forgotten!
